loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
SABALI est constituée de 4 femmes ayant en moyenne 33 ans, 7 enfants et vivant  dans des familles nucléaires à Massablacoura, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.Les prêts précédents ont été bien soldés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments alimentaires, du jardinage et d’articles divers de boutique avec  KADIA.
Arrêtée avec un enfant sous le bras, KADIA  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  deux cartons de cubes maggi , deux sacs de sucre et 1 carton de lait en poudre. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Bougouni auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au  marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle est mixte, KADIA vend au détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000.FCFA  par mois dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
SABALI consists of four women who average 33 years of age and seven children each. They live in nuclear families in Massablacoura, a district of the city of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of Mali).

This is their seventh collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. All prior loans were correctly repaid. 

Their activities include gardening, selling food condiments, and in KADIA’s case, selling sundries. She is the one holding a child in the photo. She will use her loan to buy two boxes of Maggi cubes (bouillon), two bags of sugar, and one carton of powdered milk. She buys her merchandise from wholesalers at the big market of Bougouni, and conducts her sales at the same market and from home, for cash or credit. She sells at retail to a mixt clientele.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFAF, part of which she will use to help support her husband with the daily expenses. Any remainder will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy sundries for resale.

loans.name: Ntiwigunge/rbmb Group

texts.fr:
Amisa fait partie du groupe Ntiwigunge/Rbmb. Elle a 34 ans, elle est mariée avec 3 enfants de 10 ans à 14 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Amisa est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique et les semences  sélectionnent. Dans les prochaines années, Amisa voudrait être un grand cultivateur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de scolariser et soigner ses enfants et construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en: Amisa is part of the Ntiwigunge/Rbmb group. She is 34, and married with 3 children aged 10 - 14, 3 of whom are in school. She has completed 3 years of secondary education. Amisa is a rice farmer. This is her first loan with ACB. She will use her loan to purchase chemical fertiliser. Her growth strategy for the business is to use chemical fertiliser and selected seed. In the coming years, Amisa would like to become a major rice farmer in her region. With the profits, she intends to put her children through school, to care for them, and to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertiliser

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo  para la compra de materiales para el negocio, comprara maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, condimentos, aceite, estos son los más necesarios para la elaboración de las pupusas ya que quiere por el momento fortalecer esta actividad.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ha ayudado para mejorar y contribuir con los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
María is requesting another loan to buy supplies for her business.  She will buy corn, "quesillo" [soft cheese], cracklings, seasonings, and oil.  These are the most necessary ingredients to make "pupusas" [thick corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, meat, or beans] because right now she wants to strengthen this activity.

She considers that the previous loan has helped her improve and contribute with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn, "quesillo" [soft cheese], cracklings, seasonings, and oil.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary, aged 50, is a single mother of two children aged 19 and 22 years. She runs a salon business that has been in operation for 11 years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 26,000.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the funds to buy products like hair  chemicals, hair treatments and dryers. Rosemary hopes to open another salon in future.

loans.use: To buy products such as hair  chemicals, hair treatments, and dryers

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, aged 45, is married and blessed with five children aged between 6 and 18 years. He sells cereals and has been doing this for 11 years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 6,800.

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the funds to buy cereals like rice, beans, and maize to sell. Joseph hopes to educate his children and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy cereals like rice, beans, and maize to sell.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: La Sra. Mirtha tiene 23 años, se dedica  a  la venta de cotillones para distintos acontecimientos sociales no es casada pero convive con su pareja con el cual tiene un hijo de 6 años, se dedica al  Servicio de cotillón desde hace 2 años, su tienda se encuentra en la localidad de  Torno, este es el primer préstamo que tiene con la institución, La Sra. Mirtha va a usar este préstamo para la compra de azulejos para su vivienda, ya que le falta hacer poner el piso,  Mirtha  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son Crecer en clientela para si generar mas ingresos y por ende crecer en su negocio,  va a utilizar los beneficios del crédito  Para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Mirtha se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mirtha is 23; she makes a living selling party supplies for different social events. She is not married, but lives with her partner, with whom she has a six year old son. She has been providing party supplies for two years and her shop can be found in the town of Torno. 

This is her first loan with the institution. Mirtha is going to use this loan to buy tiles for her home, as she needs to lay the floor. Mirtha faces challenges in her business, which are, increasing customers in order to generate more income, and consequently expand her business. She is going to use the benefits the loan gives to improve her family's quality of life. Mirtha feels happy, and grateful for the support offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy floor tiles for her home.

loans.name: Pedrino

texts.es:
Pedrino, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra productos para el negocio como el arroz, maíz, azúcar, aceite, huevos, productos instantáneos y enlatados,  para surtir el negocio y mantener en el buen servicio a los clientes.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le ha servido para prosperar y que su familia cuente con ingresos más seguros.
texts.en:
Pedrino is requesting another loan to buy products for his business, such as rice, corn, sugar, oil, eggs, instant products, and canned goods, to stock the business and maintain his good customer service.

He considers that the previous loan has helped him to prosper and helped his family to count on a more stable income.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, sugar, oil, eggs, instant products, and canned goods.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a resident of and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is aged 36 and has been in active farming for two years producing eggs, sugarcane, and vegetables for the local market. She does tailoring for additional income.

Pamela has requested a loan of KES 30,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry birds to boost her poultry business. She says the two years she has been an active poultry farmer have given her confidence on the benefits she stands to reap from the business. She reiterates the income will help her repay the loan and meet her family's basic needs.

She however points out that animal diseases and drought are the major challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius, aged 50, is married to Rosemary and blessed with two children. He is a horticultural farmer earning a monthly income of KES.13,500. Now requesting  his first loan from KADET LTD., Julius will use the funds to buy seedlings to plant, and hopes to export the flowers in the future.

loans.use: to buy flower seedlings.

loans.name: Tempora Mercedes

texts.es:
Tempora tiene 45 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos de quienes es responsable, conjuntamente con sus esposo viven en un caserío de nombre “Laynas” del distrito de La Matanza la misma que pertenece a la provincia de Morropón en Piura. La casa en la que viven es propia y es un caserío pequeño, donde los pobladores son muy cordiales.

Tempora se dedica exclusivamente a la venta de chicha de jora (bebida oriunda de los incas), ella desde muy tempranas horas inicia la preparación de sus insumos con los que obtendrá la chicha para ser comercializada a sus vecinos y personas que trabajan en campo, ya su negocio lo viene manejando hace cuatro años aproximadamente, a la fecha ya tiene sus clientes quienes brindan buenas referencias por la forma de atención que brinda.

Ella quiere seguir creciendo económicamente para poder mejorar su calidad de vida por lo que se está proyectando a sembrar fríjol para lo que necesita capital de trabajo para la compra de fertilizantes y el pago de sus trabajadores, por el motivo que esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1508 Nuevos Soles los cuales le permitirá cumplir sus objetivos, sabe que con la ayuda de su esposo es que podrá cumplir el deseo de darle una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Tempora is 45 years old.  She is married and has two children for whom she is responsible.  She and her husband live together in a village named Laynas in the district of La Matanza, in the province of Morropón in Piura.  The house they live in is their own, and it is a small village where the residents are very friendly.

Tempora works exclusively selling "chicha de jora" [traditional corn liquor] (a beverage native to the Incas).  From very early in the morning she begins preparing her ingredients from which she will get the chicha to be sold to her neighbors and people who work in the country.  She has been running her business for approximately four years now.  Currently she has her customers who give her good references for the service she offers.

She wants to continue growing economically to be able to improve her quality of life, for which she is planning to grow beans.  She needs working capital to buy fertilizer and pay her workers.  For this reason she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for a total of 1508 PEN, which will allow her to achieve her goals.  She knows that with the help of her husband she will be able to fulfill her desire to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
Edmundo tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive junto a su esposa, cuenta con casa propia en el caserío de Laynas que depende del distrito de la Matanza, y el mismo a la provincia de Morropón en Piura. Su comunidad es una zona rustica donde la gente normalmente es muy amable y cordial.

Se dedica a la agricultura, para lo que en la actualidad tiene sembrado una producción de plátanos de seda la cual los comercializa no solo en los mercado de su zona donde vive si no que también tiene sus clientes de los mercados de la Provincia, ha esta actividad se viene dedicando ya un promedio de 5 años, su esposa ayuda a generar ingresos diarios dedicándose a la venta de chicha de jora (bebida oriunda de los incas), actividad para la cual tiene que empezar desde muy tempranas horas para su preparación, son ambos esposos los que se han propuesto mejorar su calidad de vida poniendo muchas ganas a cada negocio.
Ahora el esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1508 Nuevos Soles con los cuales comprara fertilizantes (urea) para abonar sus sembrios.
Pues cuentan con muy buenas referencias de parte de sus vecinos de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Edmundo is 54 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives together with his wife and children in his own home, in the small village of Laynas, in Matanza district, in Morropón province, Piura.  His community is in a rural area where the people are generally very kind and friendly.

Edmundo is a farmer and he currently has an output of bananas which he sells not only in the markets in his area but also to customers that he has in markets elsewhere in the province.  He has been in this business for approximately five years.  His wife helps him to make daily income by selling 'chicha de jora' (a native drink of the Incas).  She has to get up very early in the morning to prepare her 'chicha'.  Both Edmundo and his wife have decided to improve their quality of life by putting a lot of effort into their businesses.

Edmundo is requesting a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizers (urea) so that he can fertilize his crops.  He has very good references from the neighbors in his community.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers (urea) for his crops

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Tete, Centro de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 1 filho que frequenta a Escola. Fez a 10ª classe parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta a sua mãe e irmão que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Tete para Maputo no distrito de Boane em missão de estudos, é bombeira da Galp há mais de 7 anos onde tem um salário de 4.300.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção da sua casa (areia, pedra, cimento, barrotes, e outros). O empréstimo anterior foi de 12.000.00mt aplicado na habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua família, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Beatriz was born in Tete Province, central Mozambique.  She is a single mother of a school age son.  She completed her schooling through grade 10 and then stopped due to her parents lack of funds.  She lives in her own home with her family and provides for her mother and sister who live with her. 

She left the city of Tete for the Boane district of Maputo to futher her studies. She is a Galp firefighter for the past 7 years and receives a monthly salary of 4.300 MT [Mozambique maticais] which she applies to household expenses and a small BIM [Banco Internacional de Moçambique] savings account. 

She has never had a loan with other banks.  She learned of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her second Hluvuku loan for 15,000 Mozambique maticais [approximately $550] with which she plans to buy home construction materials (sand, stone, concrete, beams and other housing construction materials). The previous 12,000 maticais loan was also applied towards housing.

She is committed to repaying the loan and completing her home for the betterment of her family.  In the future, she hopes to be able to request another loan from Hluvuku.

loans.use: Sand, bricks, cement, wooden beams, other housing construction materials

loans.name: El Renacer De Chacrasana Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “El Renacer de Chacrasana” está conformado por 09 mujeres emprendedoras y responsables. Elba tiene 57 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos independientes. Con los deseos de superarse  y de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia  Elba toma la decisión de emprender su propio negocio instalando en su domicilio una librería bazar la cual lleva más de 08 años en ese rubro. Elba está orgullosa ya que con la ayuda de su esposo a logrado que sus hijos sean profesionales. Actualmente apoya a una de sus nietas con su educación. El crédito solicitado lo utilizará para comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, fólderes y plumones y así tener que ofrecer a sus clientes por campaña escolar. El deseo de Elba es de seguir trabajando positivamente y así seguir ayudando  a su nieta. La Alcancía Comunal “El Renacer de Chacrasana” están agradecidos con el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien.
texts.en:
The communal bank ‘El Renacer de Chacrasana’ is made up of 9 enterprising and responsible women. 

Elba is 57 and married with 3 children, who live independently. Elba made the decision to start her own business because she wanted to get ahead and afford her family a better quality of life. She set up a stationery in her home and she has been in this line of work for 8 years. Elba is proud, because with her husband’s help she has succeeded in her children becoming professionals. Currently she is supporting one of her granddaughters with her education. 

She will use the loan requested to buy school equipment, such as notebooks, ballpoint pens, folders and felt-tip pens so she will have them to offer her customers for the school year. Elba’s wish is to continue working positively and therefore continue to help her granddaughter. The communal bank ‘El Renacer de Chacrasana’ are grateful for the loan offered and they are committing to continue working well.

loans.use: buy exercise books, ballpoint pens, folders and felt-tip pens

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is the father of two children, aged 18 and 13, both attending school. He is 42 years old and has spent half of his life in the farming business. Elias currently produces beans, maize, potatoes and milk, which he sells to the local market. He also works as a mason and runs a retail shop.

Elias has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a zero grazing unit for his dairy cows. He says the income earned from the dairy business will boost the family's financial security and food, since they will have milk for daily consumption. Elias says this his major challenges are insufficient rains and animal diseases, with the later attracting more costs on a regular basis.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, aged 41, is married to Ezekiel and blessed with four children aged between 5 and 20 years old. Ann does tailoring, which provides her with a monthly income of KES 30,000.

This is Ann's sixth loan from KADET LTD and she has successfully repaid the previous loans. She will use the funds to buy an overlock sewing machine. Ann hopes to open a dressmaking college in the future.

loans.use: To buy an overlock machine

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza, 51, is a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a single parent to her four children. She and her children manage their household while operating their business. Liza works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Liza operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil or an egg. Liza earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Liza earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Liza is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Liza hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Abdoulaye Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur  Abdoulaye Mamadou  est  un jeune de 30 ans qui vend des produits agricoles : des céréales, du mil  depuis 6 ans de cela .Il collecte les commandes avant d’aller en voyage. Abdoulaye Mamadou est mariée  et père de 2 enfants âgés respectivement  de 3 ans et 1 an. IL a comme charges la dépense quotidienne de son foyer .Avec le crédit qu’il sollicite, il compte augmenter  son stock de marchandises en allant se ravitailler dans un village appelé Diawbé ou elle va acheter une grande quantité de mil. Dans l’avenir  il envisage d’ouvrir  une boulangerie car il n’y en a pas dans les environs.
texts.en: Mr. Abdoulaye Mamadou, 30, is a young man who has been selling agricultural products, cereals and millet, for 6 years. He gathers orders before going on trips. Abdoulaye Mamadou is a married father of 2 children, aged 3 and 1. He is in charge of the daily expenses of his household. With the loan he is requesting, he will be able to increase his inventory by going to stock up on merchandise in the village of Diawbé where he will buy large quantities of millet. In the future, he hopes to open a bakery, as there are none in the vicinity.

loans.use: buy cereals and millet.

loans.name: Sainabou

texts.fr: Malgré son âge, madame Sainabou s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle est âgée de 73 ans. Son activité consiste à aller vendre des fruits, des beignets, de la cola à la gare routière de la ville. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle est à son premier prêt car vu la conjoncture actuel les denrées alimentaires deviennent de plus en plus chères. C’ est pourquoi elle sollicite l’appui financier de la caisse pour faire sa commande de beignets à la boulangerie car c’est là-bas qu’elle se ravitaille. Elle va aussi acheter une variété de fruits : orange, mandarine, banane... Sainabou n’a pas de charges car elle a de grands enfants qui se chargent de cela. Elle travaille parce qu’elle aime cela et quelle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: In spite of her age, Madame Sainabou has worked in commerce for 20 years. She is 73 years old. She sells fruit, donuts and cola at the village train station. She’s married and the mother of a family. She’s requesting her 1st loan in view of the current economic situation, which is causing foodstuffs to become more and more expensive. That’s why she is requesting financial support from the bank to buy donuts at the bakery, as that is where she gets a fresh supply. She’ll also buy a variety of fruits: oranges, mandarins and bananas. Sainabou has no dependents to take care of as her older children take care of them. She works because she likes it and she wants to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: buy fruit, donuts and cola to resell.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 30 years old. He is married to Catherine. He has been farming for the past eight years, bringing in a good income.

This is his fifth loan from KADET LTD. He will use his loan to pay for seedlings, fertilizer and labour for his farm.

His hope is to venture into the matatu (minibus transportation) business.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings, fertilizer and labour for his farm.

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr:
Madame Rokhaya, âgé de 47 ans est commerçante depuis 8 ans. Chaque matin elle se munie de son grand bol rempli de beignets, de fruits et de cola ; destination le garage Dakar, son lieu de vente.
Rokhaya est marié et mère de famille. Depuis qu’elle est au courant de l’existence de la mutuelle, elle a décidé de venir solliciter l’aide de cette dernière pour  améliorer son activité. Avec le crédit, elle va acheter des fruits  et de la cola pour revendre dans le garage.
Elle n’a pas de charge et avec les bénéfices, elle réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Madame Rokhaya, 47, has worked in commerce for 8 years. Every morning she gathers her big bowl full of donuts, fruit and cola and heads to the Dakar garage, her point of sale location. 
Rokhaya is a married and has a family. Since she’s been informed of the existence of the bank, she has decided to request some help to improve her business. 
With this credit, she will buy fruit, donuts and cola to resell at the garage. She has no dependents, and with the benefits, she reinvests in her business.

loans.use: buy fruit, donuts and cola to resell.

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es:
Ana, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo por que quiere continuar creciendo en el negocio, el dinero de este crédito lo utilizara en la compra de maíz, ademas comprara dos novillas, esto le ayudara a obtener a mejor precio el maiz si lo compra de contado, ademas de tener ganado.
Ella considera que él préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas y que su negocio fuera más prospero.
texts.en: Ana decided to request a new loan so that her business can continue growing.  She will use the money to buy corn and two young cows.  This will help her get a better price for the corn because she can buy it with cash as well as having cows.  She says that the earlier loan helped her with her sales and making her business more prosperous.

loans.use: to buy corn and two young cows

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Arrieros, se dedica a la venta y compra de quesos, Felicitas va a la chacra para comprar, ella es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 10 años, siempre trató de ser mejor, con las capacitaciones le ayudan a poder ser mejor madre para sus 8 hijos, ella aprendió mucho de como tener un mejor negocio, recuerda mucho los consejos de la Morenita, y agradece el apoyo a las mujeres que recién están haciendo un negocio. Ahora su meta es poder terminar de hacer su casa. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en al compra de quesos.
texts.en: Felicitas is a member of the Communal Bank “Arrieros”. She buys and sells cheese. She goes to the farm to buy it. She’s been a member of FINCA Peru for 10 years. She’s always tried to be better and the training she’s received helps her be a better mother to her 8 children. She learned a lot about how to have a better business. She remembers the advice given by a member nicknamed “la Morenita” and is grateful for the support she’s received from the women who are currently asking for loans. Now her goal is to finish building her house. The loan she is requesting is to buy cheese.

loans.use: buy cheese.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
This is Marissa, 46, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Amado, her business partner, and is the mother of three children. Marissa, together with her husband and children, manages the household while running the business. She is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Marissa operates a market stall. She sells vegetables, raw products and condiments in the community market. She buys vegetables and other common items used in cooking and sell them by weight or individually. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 22,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more vegetables and condiments to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marissa dreams of giving her all her children a high-quality education and of building a house in her province. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week. She draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To stock additional vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 35 years of age and married to Benbos. They live in Nakuru with their three children. Rose has been a nursery school teacher for the last two years. She enjoys her work very much and is proud to provide a good education to young children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to start her own business by renting a stall in town and selling clothes.

In the future, Rose hopes to invest more in her business, thereby making more income and improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: To start a clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, aged 32, is married to Anna who runs a salon. Peter runs a music-recording studio that has been in operation for seven years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 44,000.

This is his fourth loan from KADET LTD. Peter has a good credit history with KADET. He will use the funds to buy a recording camera and hopes to own a big recording company in the future.

loans.use: To buy a recording camera.

loans.name: Fiorela

texts.es: Fiorela es socia del Banco Comunal Arrieros, tiene 24 años, es madre de 2 niños, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 2 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales, pero en este corto tiempo pudo ser mejor madre con las buenas capacitaciones que le dan, aprendió a ser mas responsable, a ahorrar, y a ser humanitaria, siente que su vida esta mejorando, antes ella solo trabajaba sin una buena dirección ahora esta bien encaminada. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en al compra de cereales.
texts.en: Fiorela is a member of the Communal Bank “Arrieros”. She’s a 24-year-old mother of 2 children. She buys and sells cereals. She’s been a member of FINCA Peru for 2 years. In this short time, she’s learned how to be a better mother, through the training she’s received she learned how to be more responsible, how to save money and how to be a humanitarian. She feels that her life is improving. Before, she worked without direction and now she feels like she’s on a path. She is requesting a loan to invest in cereals.

loans.use: buy cereals.

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en:
Wassim is a 25-year-old single man, working as a hair dresser for the past eleven years. He was young when he started working but he needed to help support his family. Wassim's childhood wasn't good but he has adapted to his environment. Most of his childhood friends were also forced to work early because of their parents' bad financial situations.

Wassim is a hard worker and liked by most of his customers. They often recommend him because he is talented.

Wassim is working on improving his business, which he established two years ago. He has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to expand his salon and start providing the wax services requested by his customers. He needs to purchase the waxing equipment.

Wassim is a hardworking man, with a good reputation and special talents. He hopes to keep improving his business by meeting his customers' needs.

loans.use: To expand the salon with a new waxing service.

loans.name: Ladies Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ladies está formado por seis mujeres trabajadoras, decidieron llamarse así porque se consideran unas damas emprendedoras.
Dentro del grupo se encuentra Patricia de 41 años, a la que cariñosamente llaman Paty, casada y con 5 hijos (21, 18, 16, 15 y 13). Cuatro de sus hijos trabajan para ayudarla con los gastos del hogar, de los cuales dos  trabajan en una tienda comercial, otro en una planta y uno le ayuda en el negocio. Patty comenzó ayudando a su mamá con la venta de productos de limpieza en el mercado para sacar adelante a sus hermanos y a ella; decidió continuar en el negocio para sacar adelante a su familia.
El sueño de Paty es incrementar las ventas para poder remodelar su casa y poner su negocio, además asegurar el futuro de sus hijos proporcionándoles estudios profesionales.
texts.en:
The Ladies group is made up of six working women who decided to call themselves that because they consider themselves enterprising ladies.  

Within the group is Patricia, who is 41 years old, and who's nickname is Paty.  She is married, with 5 children (ages 21, 18, 16, 15 and 13).  Four of her children work to help her with the household expenses.  Among those, two work at a retail store, another in a factory and one helps her with the business.  Paty started helping her mother with the sale of cleaning products in the market to help her siblings and herself get ahead.  She decided to continue with the business to help her family get ahead.  

Paty's dream is to increase sales so she can remodel her house and also put it into her business.  Also, she wants to secure the future for her children by providing them with a professional education.

loans.use: to buy more cleaning products to increase sales.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas, tiene 59 años, es dueña de una Panadería y una Bodega, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 12 años, recuerda que antes trabajaba en una chacra, siempre trabajó desde muy pequeña, desde que esta en Finca sus sueños han cambiado y lo mejor es que sus metas se están cumpliendo, ella logró tener su panadería, construir su casa, y comprar sus maquinarias, aunque el horno que tiene es a leña, esta muy agradecida por lo que tiene porque le ayuda a tener una buena estabilidad económica, ahora su sueño es poder comprar un horno en Nova, pero tiene que ahorrar, y eso también aprendió en Finca, aparte de la responsabilidad y la honestidad. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de harina, leña, azúcar y manteca.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of Villa Huatatas Communal Bank.  She is 59 years old and owns a bakery and grocery store.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 12 years.

She remembers that she used to work on a farm.  She always worked, since she was young.  Since she has been in FINCA her dreams have changed, and the best thing is that she is realizing her goals.  She managed to have her bakery, build her house, and buy her machinery, although the stove she has is wood-burning.

She is very grateful for what she has because it helps her to have good economic stability.  Now her dream is to be able to buy a Nova oven, but she has to save.  She also learned that in FINCA, as well as responsibility and honesty.

She will invest the loan she is requesting in buying flour, firewood, sugar, and lard.

loans.use: to buy flour, firewood, sugar, and lard.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga tiene 68 años de edad. Vive con su esposo en el distrito de Nueva Arica ubicado a más de 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Tiene hijos mayores que ya no viven con ella. 

Dirige una bodega donde vende abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Tiene más de 11 años de experiencia en su negocio. Cuenta con una clientela establecida y fidelizada. Es muy conocida en su región y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. Desea usar su préstamo para comprar más productos para la tienda para mejor responder al pedido de sus clientes. Ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles.
 
Se le conoce por su alto grado de responsabilidad pues ya ah tenido creditos en nuestra institucion cumpliendo de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Dominga, 67, lives with her husband in the Nueva Arica district located over 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. She has adult children that no longer live with her.

She runs a store selling groceries and basic need items. She has more than 11 years experience in her business. She has a well established regular customer base. She is very well known in her region and she has very good personal and work references.

She wants to use the loan to buy more products for the store to improve her response to customer requests. She has thought it convenient, therefore, to request a 3000 new soles loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

She is known for being very responsible, as she’s already had loans with our institution that she has paid punctually.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa has sold maize at Eguafo near Elmina for the past ten years. She is married to a farmer and has four children. Adjoa uses her income to support her husband and to feed and clothe her family. 

Adjoa needs this loan to purchase bags of maize to sell. With her profits, Adjoa wishes to acquire a large quantity of maize to distribute to retailers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a fish monger at Eguafo near Elmina. For the past five years, she has sold fried fish. She is married to a farmer and has four children. Ama uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale. With the profits Ama wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama extracts oil from palm kennel to sell at Eguafo near Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has four children. 
Ama has been selling oil for 10 years now. She uses her income to help her husband pay their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase more palm kennel. With the profit, Ama will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm kennel for the extraction of oil to sell.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Arrieros, tiene 52 años, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, y en este tiempo llego a valorarse mucho, es una mujer que se esta esforzando mucho por sacar adelante a su familia, ella es la Presidenta de su Banco Comunal, y siempre esta tratando de dar un buen ejemplo, se dedica la venta de cereales al por mayor, es madre de 2 hijos, las capacitaciones le ayudaron a poder tener un negocio sólido, y ser próspera, ella desea seguir progresando, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de cereales.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of Arrieros Communal Bank.  She is 52 years old and the mother of two children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years, and in this time she came to value herself a lot.  She is a woman who is making a big effort to get her family ahead.  She is the president of her communal bank, and she is always trying to set a good example.

She works selling cereals wholesale.  The training helped her to be able to have a solid business and be prosperous.  She wants to continue making progress.  Now, with the loan, she will invest in buying cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is a small business owner. She has operated a grocery for five years. She sells different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc.. Maame is married with four children. She uses her income to help her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the profit, Maame plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara continues her fruit and vegetable business. Her son is still helping her in the business, and this is how they support their family. Tamara’s husband doesn’t have regular work so he sometimes fulfills private construction orders. 

Tamara used her two previous Kiva loans to enlarge her assortment of goods. Now she needs a 550,000 AMD loan to buy potatoes, grapes, apples, pears, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, grapes, apples, pears, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Noemi Yaneth

texts.es:
Noemi  tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su madre de 73 años de edad en la ciudad de imperial, Ciudad que se caracteriza por la importante actividad comercial de sus habitantes. En sus alrededores se encuentra la Fortaleza de Ungará, último vestigio de la Cultura Huarco, antiguo Cañete. También se hallan antiguas haciendas instaladas entre las extensas áreas de cultivo, ella es muy humilde y sobre todo es muy trabajadora con mucho esfuerzo inicio su negocio de venta de abarrotes desde hace 4 años, ella es muy amable con los clientes por elo siempre regresan a su negocio.

Noemi está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo  ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio en especial utiles escolares (cuadernos, lapiceros, colores, folders, entre otros) así le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos parar ofrecer a sus clientes y seguirá luchando día a día para cumplir su gran sueño:”Tener su casa propia”
texts.en:
Noemi is 42 years old and lives with her 73-year-old mother in the city of Imperial, a city that is characterized by the important commercial activity of the people who live there.  Around the city is the Fortaleza de Ungará, the last vestige of the Huarco Culture, in ancient Cañete.  Also, one can find old farms among extensive cultivated areas.  

She is very humble and above all is very hard-working and started her grocery business with a lot of effort 4 years ago.  She is very nice to her customers, and for that reason they always return to her business.

Noemi is very grateful for the Kiva loans, since with its support she can buy merchandise for her business, especially useful school supplies (notebooks, pens, paints, and folders, among others) and this will give her the opportunity to have a greater variety of products to offer her customers and continue fighting daily toward her big dream:  "To have her own house".

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the school season (notebooks, paints, pens, and folders, among others).

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro, quiere seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, quiere comprar unas mesas y bancas de madera, con la intensión de brindar mayor comodidad a los clientes y tener mejor vistosidad.
El efecto que tuvo Milagro con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ya que realizo todas las compras y aumento las ventas en el negocio.
texts.en:
Milagro would like to continue investing in her business. With this loan, she wants to buy some wooden tables and benches in order to offer her clients more comfort and an improved look. 

The previous loan was a very positive experience for Milagro, as she was able to make all her purchases and increase her business sales.

loans.use: buy wooden tables and benches.

loans.name: Aunty

texts.en:
Aunty cooks banku for sale. She serves it with fried fish, peppers, and tomato sauce in Nyame Bekyere near Elmiina. She is married to a farmer and has no children. Aunty has been in this business for some years now. 

Aunty uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills. With her loan she will purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing banku for sale. She hopes to use the profit from her expanded business to build a better stall for her banku sales.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses to prepare banku for sale.

loans.name: Maame Ekua

texts.en: Maame Ekua extracts palm oil for sale at Eguafo near Elmina. Maame is married and has six children. She has been in this business for some years now. She uses her income to help her husband support their family. She will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit, from which she will extract oil to sell. With the profit Maame will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit for oil extraction.

loans.name: Atong

texts.en:
Atong lives in Bor. She has sold fish for the past three years. She is 32 years old, and married with four children. All of them are still in school. 

Atong heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio es padre de casa de 42 años. Vive con su esposa y tres hijos en casa propia en la ciudad de Morropon en Piura, a unas cuatro horas de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 10 años, gana su vida como obrero de campo. Y adicionalmente a la crianza y venta de animales menores los cuales cría en la parte posterior de su casa. Es muy responsable en sus deberes laborales. Este trabajo le ayuda solventar sus gastos familiares. Actualmente, a su casa le faltan algunos arreglos debido a que las constantes lluvias la han deteriorado y desea hacer unos arreglos y a la vez comprar alimentos balanceados para la alimentación de sus animales. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles. 
Rogelio es muy conocido en la zona y posee buenas referencias laborales y personales de su comunidad. Es un cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa y siempre cumple con sus obligaciones de deuda en una manera puntual.
texts.en:
Rogelio is 42 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in his own home in the city of Morropón, in Piura, four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. 

For more than 10 years, Rogelio has earned his living by working as a farm laborer. He also sells small animals that he raises in his backyard. He is very responsible in his work and his work helps him to cover his family's expenses. 

Rogelio's home is currently in a bad state of repair due to the constant rain. He would like to carry out some repairs and buy food for his animals. For this reason, he has requested a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Rogelio is very well known in his area and has good work references and personal references from his community. He is a long-standing client of Edpyme Alternativa and always makes his loan repayments on time.

loans.use: buy food for his animals and repair his house.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa cooks banku for sale. She serves it with fried fish, peppers, and tomato sauce at Eguafo near Abura. She is a single parent with three children.  Adjoa has been in this business for some years now. As a single parent, she uses her income to support her children. She will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing banku for sale. She hopes to use the profit from her expanded business to build a better banku stall.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing banku for sale.

loans.name: Nyanthic

texts.en:
Nyanthic lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in this business for three years. She is 35 years old and married with four children. All of them are still in school. 

Nyanthic heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Maame Aba

texts.en: Maame Aba sells charcoal at Eguafo near Elmina. She is married with five children. Her husband is a farmer. Maame has been selling charcoal for five years. She uses her income to help her husband to pay their utility bills. Maame will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With the profit from her expanded business, Maame wishes to produce the charcoal herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora extracts palm kennel oil to sell at Eguafo near Elimina. She is single. Nora has been doing this for some years now. She uses her inome to pay school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase palm kennel for the extraction of oil to sell. With the profit from her expanded business, Nora wishes to get a good education.

loans.use: to purchase palm kennel for oil extraction.

loans.name: Brillantes Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal   ”BRILLANTES ESTRELLAS”, inicia su tercer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de diez  integrantes, donde  la señora Dolores es la presidenta. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio: trenzado de mantas, venta de chompas, venta de fruta, tienda de abarrotes, venta de verduras, confección de deportivos.

La Dolores es una mujer de 41 años de edad, soltera madre de tres hijos. Hace doce años que integra asociaciones comunales, trabajando desde ese entonces con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de abarrotes) mismo que adquirirá de la Ciudad de El Alto y lo comercializará en su espacio de venta, todos los días.

Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella menciona que le gusta los prestamos sencillos y que las capacitaciones son útiles.
texts.en:
The "Brillantes Estrellas" communal bank is starting its third loan cycle in the Andes regional office. Ten members participate in this communal bank, where Dolores is the president. The women have various businesses in trade, production, and services such as braiding blankets, selling sweaters, selling fruit, managing a grocery store, selling vegetables, and making sportswear. 

Dolores is a 41-year-old single mother with three children. She joined the communal bank twelve years ago and since then has been working in the grocery store business. The loan she will take out is to increase her merchandise by buying groceries that she will purchase from the city of El Alto. She will market it in her sales space every day. 

When we asked her what she likes the most about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the simple loans and that the training is useful.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luís es un joven emprendedor de 37 años de edad, casado y con tres hijos, actualmente esta viviendo en casa propia y junto a su familia en el distrito de la Matanza ubicado en la Provincia de Morropón en Piura, a mas de cuatro horas al norte de la Ciudad de Chiclayo.

Luís se dedica desde hace 3 año al servicio de transporte de pasajeros para lo que cuenta con una mototaxy, en el mismo caserío, es muy conocido ya que su paradero esta en un lugar estratégico para captar a sus clientes, pues cuando desean de sus servicios se comunican vía teléfono para solicitarlos. El también se dedica a la agricultura por lo que hoy tiene las intensiones de sembrar Fríjol, pues ya tiene el terreno preparado para la siembra.
El esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1508 Nuevos Soles con los cuales cubrirá los gastos de personal y en la compra de fertilizantes, lo que ayudará a su mejor desarrollo de sus plantaciones.

Ya anteriormente ha sido cliente de nuestra institución cumpliendo de manera responsable con sus pagos pactados.
texts.en:
Luís is a young entrepreneur.  He is 37 years old, married, and has three children.  He is currently living in his own home together with his family, in Matanza district, in Morropón province, in Piura, more than four hours to the north of the city of Chiclayo.

Luís has been providing a passenger transport service with his motorcycle taxi for three years.  He provides this service in his own village.  He is very well known because his stand is in a strategic position so that he can attract customers.  When people need his services they contact him on the telephone to request them.  Luís also works in agriculture and he plans to sow beans because he has a plot of land ready for this.

Luís is requesting a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to cover personal expenses and to buy fertilizers.  This will help him to better develop his plantations.

Luís is an existing client of our institution and has made his previous repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay laborers to work on his land

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred, 44 years old, is married to Barack. They are blessed with four children aged between 16 and 24 years. She has been a tailor for eight years.

This is her sixth loan from KADET LTD. She has a good credit history in KADET. She will use the funds to buy an electric sewing machine.

Mildred hopes to open a big tailoring shop and employ people in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy, se dedica a la venta de ropa al por mayor, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 2 años, en este corto tiempo, puede ver en su negocio un notable progreso, al inicio ella empezó con muy poco de préstamo, pero poco a poco fue prestándose mas, ella esta muy satisfecha con Finca, porque puede aprende acerca de la buena comunicación que existe en su Banco Comunal, el ahorro y sumando con las buenas capacitaciones que le brindan  le ayudan a poder tener un mejor negocio, estas capacitaciones también le ayudan para poder educar a sus 3 hijos, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropa por mayor para la Semana Santa.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Tu Ángel Lucy communal bank. She makes a living by selling wholesale clothing. She has been a member of Finca Peru for two years and in this short amount of time, she can see notable progress in her business. At first, she began with very small loans, but little by little she was borrowing more. 

She is very satisfied with Finca because she can learn about the good communication that exists at her communal bank. The savings and the good training that they offer help her to have a better business. This training also helps enable her to educate her three children. 

She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale clothing for Holy Week.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores es socia del Banco Comunal Arrieros, tiene 39 años, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, ahora ella es la Tesorera en su Banco Comunal, al principio no quería pero ahora es un cargo que le genera responsabilidad y ella esta muy feliz en poder apoyar a su Bancomunal, Dolores es madre de 2 hijos, lo que desea es poder progresar para poder darle una estabilidad económica a sus hijos, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes.
texts.en: Dolores is a member of the Arrieros communal bank.  She is 39 years old, and makes a living selling groceries.  She has been a member of Finca Perú for 4 years.  She is currently the treasurer of her communal bank.  At first she did not want the position because it carries a lot responsibility, but now she is very happy that she can support her communal bank.  Dolores has 2 children, and she wants to make progress so she can provide her children with economic stability.  She will use the loan to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Exilda

texts.es:
Exilda tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija, viven junto a su esposo para lo que cuentan con casa propia, la misma que esta ubicada en el caserio “Chumbenique” situado en el distrio de Oyotun, perteneciente a la Provincia de Chiclayo y esta a unas 3 horas aproximadamente. En su caserio tanto ella como su familia cuentan con buenas referencias personales y laborales.

Exilda se dedica desde hace 5 atrás a la venta de pescado y de pollo sacrificado, para lo cuenta con un pequeño puesto de venta en el mercado del mismo caserío, ya tiene su clientela la cual la busca todos los días por la buena atención que ella brinda, recibe el apoyo de su hija los fines de semana ya que de lunes a viernes estudia en el colegio secundario.

Ahora ella solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles los cuales invertirá en la compra útiles escolares con motivo de que se están por empezar el nuevo año escolar.
texts.en:
Exilda, 41, is married and lives with her husband and daughter in their own house. They live in the rural community of Chumbenique in the district of Oyotun of the province of Chiclayo. In her rural community she and her family have good work references and personal references.

Exilda has been selling fish and chicken for the last 5 years in the community market. She has her clientele who buy from her every day because of her good service. On the weekends, her son helps out, as he’s in high school during the week.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the amount of 1000 new soles, which she will invest in school supplies since the new school year is about to start.

loans.use: buy school supplies.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos, se ha decidido por obtener un nuevo préstamo, ya que el negocio está teniendo un buen momento, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de hilos de seda y nailon para elaborar hamacas, esto le ayudara para disponer de materiales y aumentar la producción.
Ella considera que estos préstamos le han sido de mucha utilidad, porque ha mejorado sus ventas.
texts.en:
Santos has decided to request a new loan because his business is doing well right now.  He will invest his money in buying silk threads and nylon for making hammocks.  This will help him to have materials available and increase his production.

Santos believes these loans to be very useful because he has improved his sales.

loans.use: to buy silk threads and nylon for making hammocks

loans.name: Magdalena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Magdalena, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la agricultura, porque comprara 5 sacos de abono y herbicidas, con estos materiales tendrá lo necesario para tratar la tierra y poder iniciar la siembra de maíz.
Ella considera que con el préstamo anterior logro mejorar la productividad y apoyar a su familia, por eso espera que este nuevo financiamiento le traiga mejores cosechas.
texts.en:
Magdalena is requesting a new loan to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer and herbicides for her corn fields. With these supplies she will have the supplies she heeds to treat the land and she can begin planting her corn.

Magdalena believes this loan will result in improving productivity and help her family. For this reason, she hopes this new financing will bring better harvests.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer and herbicides for her corn fields.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth, 28 years old, is married and has two children. She has been selling tea leaves for 3 years.  Ruth describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Ruth has been able to grow her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. Ruth has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy tea leaves to sell.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Perpétue

texts.fr:
Perpétue est une femme âgé(e) de 49 ans. Elle est mariée å un  employé de bureau. Elle a 01 enfant. 
Perpétue travaille comme revendeuse  de volailles depuis 1992. Elle vend dans un marché et s’approvisionne à KPALIME , NOTSE.
Perpétue a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des volailles pour mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle. Elle souhaite faire prospérer son activité et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Perpétue is a 49-year-old woman.  She is married to an office worker and has one child.
She has been reselling poultry since 1992.  She stocks up in Kpalime and Notse and resells at a market.
Perpétue has requested a first loan from WAGES in order to buy poultry and better meet her customers' demand.  She wants to ensure the growth of her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James, aged 60, is married and has five children aged between 2 and 7 years old. He has been selling livestock for two years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 23,500. This is James' first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy goats for sale. James hopes to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina, 44 years old, is the mother of two children. She runs a grocery store to earn a living and employs one person. Amina describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Amina has been able to educate her children. She hopes to expand her business in the future. Amina has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and onions to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, 50 years old, is married and has 2 children. He has been in the spare car parts business for 14 years and has employed 3 people. To earn extra income, Joseph sells secondhand clothes. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Joseph has been able to educate his children. He hopes to expand his business in the future. Joseph has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy spare car parts to sell.

loans.use: To buy spare car parts to sell

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou est un homme âgé de 21 ans. Il est célibataire. 
Kokou travaille comme revendeur de chaussures depuis 2010. Il s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé et vend seul dans un marché de la place.
Kokou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des paires de chaussures . Il veut renforcer son activité et mieux se prendre  en charge.
texts.en: Kokou is a 21-year-old single man.  He has been reselling shoes since 2010.  He stocks up at the Grand Market in Lomé and sells alone at a local market.  Kokou has requested a first loan from WAGES in order to buy shoes.  He wants to boost his activity and better provide for himself.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, aged 35, is married to Grace and they are blessed with two children. Moses has been selling cereals for two years, earning a monthly income of KES 7,100 from the business.

This is Moses' first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the funds to buy cereals such as rice, beans and green grams (mung beans) for sale. Moses hopes to open a wholesale cereal store in the future.

loans.use: To buy cereals such as rice, beans and green grams to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 43 years old, is married and has three sons and two daughters. He has a store where he sells shoes, and it has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover all of life's costs. 

Ahmad is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of shoes upon customers' request. This will enable Ahmad to compete well with others, to increase sales and to improve the family's income. Ahmad is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of shoes for sale.

loans.name: Awoussi

texts.fr:
Awoussi est une femme âgé(e) de 31ans. Elle est célibataire. 
Awoussi travaille comme revendeuse d’habits pour dame  depuis 2009. Elle exerce son activité avec une personne dans une boutique et achète les marchandises à Lomé.
Awoussi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des habits pour dames. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité et s'épanouir.
texts.en: Awoussi is a 31-year-old single woman.  She has been reselling women's clothes since 2009.  She buys her merchandise in Lomé and works in a shop, with another person.  She has requested a first loan from WAGES in order to buy women's clothes.  She wants to reinvest in her business and thrive.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes.

loans.name: Njeri

texts.en:
Njeri, aged 55, is a single mother of six children.  She sells eggs and has been doing this for five years.  The business gives her a monthly income of KES 2,700. 

This is Njeri's first loan from  KADET LTD.  She will use the funds to buy more eggs for resale.  Njeri hopes to open an eggs depot in the future.

loans.use: buy eggs

loans.name: Rev Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, aged 49, is married to Alex and they are blessed with three children, aged between 7 and 17 years.  Joyce sells charcoal and has been doing this for five years.  The business earns her a monthly income of KSH 10,000.

This is Joyce's first loan term with KADET Ltd.  She will use the funds to buy more charcoal to sell.  Joyce hopes to be a large scale charcoal supplier in the future.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Nyandit

texts.en:
Nyandit lives in Bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children -- all of them are still in school. 

Nyandit heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer,  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase more charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 36 years old and is married with 2 children. She sells books and mobile phone spare parts to earn a living. She has been in this business for 5 years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. She also farms to earn extra income. 

Since Agnes joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy books and mobile phone spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy books and mobile phone spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Nyiel

texts.en:
Nyiel lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for four years. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children -- all of them are still in school. 

Nyiel heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.   This is her second loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of SDG 1000 in order to purchase more fish.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Nyanthic

texts.en:
Nyanthic lives in Bor.  She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children -- two of them are still in school. 

Nyanthic heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.   This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase more charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 31 years old, married and has 3 children. She sells chips to earn a living.  She has been in the business for one year and has employed one person.  To earn extra income, Jackline sells second-hand clothes. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Jackline has been able to save her income and she hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy potatoes to cook chips.

loans.use: buy potatoes to make chips

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 30-year-old business man.  He is married to Jackline, a business lady. They are blessed with one child.  Samuel has been selling second-hand clothes for the past four years and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000, which he uses to support his family.

Samuel is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff.  He will use the loan to buy more stocks of clothing to sell.  With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child.  His hope and dream is to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: buy used clothing

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. He runs a primary school to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 11 years and has employed 8 people.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Jackson has been able to save his income and he hopes to expand his business in the future. 

Jackson has applied for 70,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more desks for his school.

loans.use: buy desks for his school

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children -- all of them are still in school. 

Teresa heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.   This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of  SDG 500 in order to purchase more fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Callen

texts.en: Callen is 35 years old and married with one child. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for four years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and she hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 34 years old and married with two children. He runs a cereals store to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. He also does maize farming to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy maize, beans and peas to sell.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans and peas to sell

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Yom lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in this business for 2 years. She is 30 years old, married, and has no children.
 
Yom heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 61 years old. He sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living. He has been in this business for 5 years and has employed 5 people. He also farms to earn extra income. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Francis has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy mangoes, bananas and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, bananas and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is 38 years old and is married with one child. She runs a cafeteria to earn a living. She has been in this business for 7 years and has employed 3 people.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Augustine has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy rice, loaves of bread, milk, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.use: to buy rice, loaves of bread, milk, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.name: Mukhiddin

texts.ru: Мухиддин женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Он очень перспективный и трудолюбивый человек. Более 11 лет Мухиддин занимается купле- продажей мелочевки в своей лавке. Его лавка находится в центре кишлака. Кроме данного бизнеса он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Мухиддин хотел бы получить займ для покупки товара с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Mukhiddin is married and is raising four children.  He is a very promising and hardworking person.  For over 11 years Mukhiddin has been buying and selling small items in his shop.  His shop is located in the center of his village.  In addition to this business he fattens and sells livestock.  Mukhiddin would like to get a loan to purchase merchandise in order to grow his business.  He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for sale

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol lives in Bor. She sells clothes and has been in business for three years. She is 32 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are still in school. 

Achol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Silvester

texts.en: Silvester is 48 years old and married with two children. He runs a car (taxi) transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. To earn extra income, he sells timber. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and he hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a car to use in his taxi (car) transport business.

loans.use: To buy a car to use in his taxi (car) transport business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, age 24, is a single lady who runs a cosmetics shop. She has been doing this for three years and earns a monthly income of KES 4,000.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the funds to buy more cosmetics like hair chemicals, treatments and weaves for sale. Alice hopes to open a cyber cafe in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics like hair chemicals, treatments and weaves to sell

loans.name: Meritei

texts.en:
Meritei, aged 56, is married to Ane and they are blessed with seven children.  He sells livestock and has been doing that for 15 years.  The business earns him a monthly income of KES 12,000.

This is Meritei's second loan from KADET LTD.  He has repaid the previous loan successfully. He will use funds from this loan to buy two cows to rear and sell later to his customers.  Meritei hopes to educate his children and expand his business.

loans.use: buy two cows

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es: María Ofelia de cuarenta y nueve años de edad vive con sus hijas en una zona muy concurrida de personas, ella posee una tienda en el lugar donde reside, en ella vende artículos de primera necesidad frijoles, arroz, pan, bebidas entre otros. Últimamente ha aumentado la demanda pues vende productos de primera calidad a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio es excelente; María es una mujer muy dedicada a su labor, honrada y con muchos sueños para el futuro, piensa que la superación no solo llega con el tiempo, sino también con el deseo, la auto motivación, acciones inmediatas, planeación, esfuerzo y trabajo continuo; quiere ver crecer su negocio, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, bebidas etc. María Ofelia tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Maria Ofelia is 49, and lives with her daughters in an area busy with people. She has a store in her home where she sells basic household necessities such as beans, rice, bread, drinks, and other items. Lately demand has increased, as she sells top-quality products at really affordable prices; and the service is excellent. 

Maria is a woman very devoted to her work, honest, with many dreams for the future. She believes that self-improvement comes not only with time, but also through desire, self-motivation, immediate action, planning, effort, and continual work. 

She wants to see her business grow, and that is why she is applying to Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy staple grains, candy, bread, drinks, etc. Maria Ofelia has the confidence that in this way, she will be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: To buy staple grains, candy, bread, and drinks.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Asunción tiene 47 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y viven junto a su esposo, cuenta con casa propia la cual esta ubicada en el Distrito de Jayanca, perteneciente a la Provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra a una hora aproximadamente hacia el norte. En Jayanca normalmente se dedican a la agricultura la mayoría de sus habitantes.

Desde hace 5 años atrás Asunción se viene dedicando al comercio de ganado vacuno, pues los compra desde muy pequeños, los alimenta y posteriormente los ofrece a sus clientes de los mercados de la zona o a otros de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Los conocimientos adquiridos para su negocio los ha obtenido de sus padres con quienes trabajó desde muy pequeña.

Para Asunción su crecimiento económico se viene dando de manera paulatina por lo que poco a poco va invirtiendo en su negocio, ahora ella esta interesada en un crédito solicitado en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales utilizará para la compra de mas ganado vacuno con lo que aumentara su capital de trabajo y le permitirá cumplir con todos sus clientes, y a la vez con su familia a quienes desea mejorarles la calidad de vida.
Es conocido por su alto grado de responsabilidad debido a que ya anteriormente ha sido cliente nuestro, pues ah cumplido de manera puntual todos sus compromisos pactados.
texts.en:
Asunción is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and their two children. She has her own home, located in Jayanca district, which is part of Lambayeque province, and is situated approximately one hour north of Lambayeque. The majority of Jayanca's inhabitants normally work in agriculture.

Asuncion has been trading in cattle for the last five years. She buys them when they are small, feeds them, and later sells them to her customers in the area markets or to others in the city of Chiclayo.  She acquired the knowledge to run her business from her parents, with whom she worked since she was very small.

For Asunción, her financial growth has come about gradually, so little by little she is investing in her business. Now she is interested in applying to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles, that she will use to buy more cattle, and thereby increase her working capital. This will allow her to meet the needs of all of her customers, and at the same time do her best for her family, as she wishes to improve their quality of life. 

She is known for her high degree of responsibility, due to the fact that she has been our client previously, and has fulfilled all her commitments in a timely way.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 41 years old and a mother of one child. She sells sweaters, skirts and blouses to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and has employed one person. To earn extra income, she does maize farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able save her income and she hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sweaters, skirts and blouses to sell.

loans.use: To buy sweaters,skirts and blouses to sell

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en: Kanini is 38 years old and married with two children. She runs a beauty shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and has employed one person.
