To earn extra income, she does livestock farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and she hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a hair blow dry machine and a hair dryer.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and a hair dryer

loans.name: Keth

texts.en:
Keth lives in Bor. She sells foodstuff and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children -- two of them are still in school. 

Keth heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase sugar and oil to sell.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy sugar and oil

loans.name: Kavata

texts.en: Kavata still owns her salon and the business is doing well.  She is applying for her third loan from KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Kavata will use this loan to buy a dryer and chemicals for her salon.  With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to add cosmetics to her salon.

loans.use: buy a hair dryer and hair chemicals

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 49 years old.  She is a single mother of three children.  She is 49 years old.   Lucy sells herbal medicine and has been in this business for the past seven years.   This is her first loan from KADET LTD.  She was brought to KADET LTD by a client.

Lucy will this loan to purchase stocks of herbal medicine to sell.  Her dream is to sell the products wholesale in the near future.

loans.use: buy herbal medicine

loans.name: Nyang

texts.en:
Nyang lives in Bor. She sells foodstuff and has been in business for three years. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children -- all of them are still in school. 

Nyang heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.   This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase sugar and oil to sell.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy sugar and oil

loans.name: Mirgul

texts.ru: Миргул 38 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей, младшему из которых 5 лет. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Миргул занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 2000 году с 5,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 2,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Доходы от бизнес- деятельности позволяют Миргул оплачивать обучение старшего сына Суйунбека – студента 2-го курса в университете.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Миргул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы Миргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем – накопить деньги на образование для своих детей.
texts.en: Mirgul is 38 years old, is married, and has 5 children, the youngest of whom is 5 years old.  The source of income for Mirgul's family is her livestock business.  Started in 2000 with 5,000 som (KGS) her holdings now bring in around 2,000 som (KGS) per month.  The earnings from her business allow Mirgul to pay for the education of her oldest son, Suyunbek, who is a second year student at the university.  With the goal of further growing her business, Mirgul turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of livestock for fattening and resale.  Mirgul plans to invest her earnings into further increasing her livestock count and in the future to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan, está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abono y pesticidas, para poder iniciar la nueva siembra de maíz, estos préstamos le ayudan para que la plantación crezca con los cuidados necesarios.
El manifiesta que su condición como agricultor ha mejorado, y con su familia se encuentran todos bien, tambien se han visto beneficiados por los cultivos. Este es su segundo prestamo con la institucion y espera tener buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Juan is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides, in order to start a new corn crop. These loans help him ensure that his plantation grows with the necessary care. He states that his situation as a farmer has improved, and he and his family are all doing well. They have also benefitted because of the crops.

This is his second loan with the institution and he hopes to have good results.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Jose Balmore

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de más mercadería, dicha compra será en verduras frescas, zanahorias, güisquiles, papas, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le dio un efecto positivo en el negocio, por eso está decidido a seguir trabajando para desarrollarse en el mercado.
texts.en:
Jose is is requesting a new loan to buy more merchandise, such as fresh vegetables, carrots, potatoes, güisquiles (also known as chayote squash or vegetable pear)  this investment will help him improve what the business has to offer.
He thinks the previous loan had a positive impact in his business, that's why he is committed to work and position himself in the market.

loans.use: To buy fresh vegetables such as carrots, squash and potatoes

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en:
Tahani is a conservative person who is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. Thus, the man in the photo is her brother.

Tahani is a 35-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Tahani is doing handmade embroidery and selling it to neighbors and friends. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase fabrics and strings. Tahani is looking to enlarge her business by selling her products to nearby shops in addition to establishing her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and strings

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José tiene 55 años de edad, es casado y tienes hijos mayores de edad quienes ya no depende de él, cuenta con casa propia, la cual esta ubicada en el distrito de la “Matanza” en la provincia de Morropón – Piura a unas cuatro horas aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en su distrito normalmente sus vecinos se dedican a la agricultura y comercialización de ganado vacuno.

Desde hace 7 años José se dedica a la crianza, engorde y venta de ganado vacuno en los mercados de su distrito, y algunos mercados cercanos, contando ya con sus clientes quienes acuden a él por su responsabilidad en cuanto a sus compromisos comerciales. Su esposa es quien participa con los ingresos diarios dedicándose a la venta de aves de corral. Y es que ellos mediante estos negocios han sabido sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1008 Nuevos Soles, los cuales invertirá en la compra de alimento balanceado y en mejoramiento de sus instalaciones donde cria a su ganado.
Esta inversión le dará como resultado poder ofrecer a mejor precio sus animales y poder criarlos en mejor estado.
texts.en:
Jose is 55, married and has children that are adults now and don't depend on him, he has a house that he owns and that is located in the district of Matanza in the province of Morropon - Piura, approx. four hours from the city of Chiclayo, in the district his neighbors work in agriculture and commercialization of cattle.

7 years ago he started breeding, growing and selling cattle in the markets of the district and other close markets, he has customers that come to him for his responsibility in meeting terms of commercial agreements.  His wife contributes with the daily income by selling chickens, through these businesses they have been able to get their children ahead.

He is requesting a loan to Edpyme Alternative for 1008 New Soles, which he will invest in buying feed and improve his cattle barn.  This investment will help him get better prices for his cattle by growing them in a better environment.

loans.use: To buy feed and make improvements to his cattle barn

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza de 39 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 2 hijas menores de edad quienes cursan estudios primarios, cuenta con casa propia y vive en una zona urbana del distrito de Olmos, el mismo que esta a dos horas aproximadamente de la Ciudad de Chiclayo. En olmos es muy conocida por el tipo de negocio que tiene y por ser una madre de familia muy trabajadora y responsable con sus menores hijas.

Esperanza se dedica desde hace dos años atrás a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, para lo que ya cuenta con sus propios clientes que son de su mismo distrito y de caseríos aledaños, ella realiza sus pedidos de manera quincenal y los reparte recorriendo a cada uno de sus clientes, además también tiene conocimientos de costura para lo que cuenta con sus maquinas propias y brinda servicio a todos sus vecinos, de esa manera ella ha sabido salir adelante con sus hijas.

Ahora ella quiere invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos debido a que cuenta con bastantes pedidos con los que tiene que cumplir, por el motivo que esta solicitando un crédito en edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales le servirán para cumplir dichos objetivos.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 39 years old. She is a single mother with two young children who are in primary school. She has her own house which is located in the urban zone of the Olmos District. This area is located about two hours from Chiclayo City. In Olmos, Esperanza is well known for the type of business that she runs. She is a hard-working mother and very responsible for her minor children.
For the past two years, Esperanza has been selling beauty products from a catalogue. Her customers are from her district and nearby areas. She submits her orders every fifteen days and then distributes the products to each of her customers. She also is a seamstress and she has her own sewing machine. She sews for all of her neighbors. In this manner she is able to progress along with her children.
Now she would like to invest in her business by buying a greater quantity of her products. She currently has more orders than she can fill. This is why she is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 New Soles. This loan will help her achieve her objectives

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 46-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of seven children.

Dalal is looking to improve her family living conditions. Thus, she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do maintenance on her home.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her home

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old. She is married to Mwenja and together they have two grown-up children. She operates a motorcycle spare parts shop and has been in the business for the past 10 years.

This is her first term loan from KADET LTD. She was brought to KADET LTD by another client. She will use the loan to purchase more spare parts.

She hopes to venture into the real estate business.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Kaduku 2 Star Group

texts.en:
Peter lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is 52 years old and married with four children. For the last 30 years, he has been in farming. He started with five acres and now has 20 acres of maize. His dream is to build a permanent house and pay school fees. Farming inputs are not readily available causing poor yields. Peter wants a loan to buy seeds for planting.

He is a member of Kaduku 2 Star group where members guarantee each other in order to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Reyna Izabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel,de 22 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo ella se dedica a la elavoracin de güipiles y venta de cosmeticos desde hace 3 años,ya obtubo un primer credito el cual le ayudo mucho porque pudo aumentar aun mas su capital,es por eso que esta solicitando este nuevo credito ya que nececita un poco mas de mercaderia,nececita comprar mas materia prima para la elavoracion de güipiles y compra de cosmeticos para la venta,esta muy agradecida con Kiva ya que le han ayudado mucho con su negocio.
texts.en: Reyna Isabel is 22 years old and has one child. She makes “guipiles” (colorful, handwoven garments) and she sells cosmetics. She has been in business for the past three years. She has already received one loan. It helped her a lot as it provided her with working capital. Now she is asking for another loan as she needs a little more merchandise. She needs to buy the necessary supplies in order to make “guipiles” and she will buy cosmetics which she will sell. She is thankful for KIVA, as they have helped her a lot with her business.

loans.use: to buy the needed material to make "guipiles" and to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Ekiru

texts.en:
Ekiru is 52 years old. He is married to Elizabeth and together they have two children. He operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was brought to KADET LTD, by one of our clients. He will use the loan to purchase stock of sugar, salt, rice and cooking fat.

His dream is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en: Evelyne wants a loan to pay school fees and buy soap, sugar, rice and salt to sell. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She desires to educate her child and diversify her business. Price fluctuations and thieves hinder her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees and buy soap, sugar, rice and salt to sell.

loans.name: Milton

texts.en: Milton lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is 52 years old and married with four children. He runs a hardware shop. His dream is to educate his children and expand his business into new markets. Customers not paying on time and seasonal weather affect his business. Milton wants a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is 33 years old and married with one child. She sells movie tapes to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and she hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy movie tapes to sell.

loans.use: To buy movie tapes to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet wants a loan to pay school fees. She is age 39 and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is a widow charged with the responsibility of taking care of five children. She is a rice huller and with the proceeds, she has been able to provide for her children. She desires to educate her children and build a permanent structure for her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 49-year-old lady from Kisumu city and is married to Muga. They have four children who are 14, 17, 20 and 25 years old.

Jane sells clothing, a business she has been doing for the last 10 years. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy full dresses, skirts, trousers and jackets. 

Her profits will be used to repay her loan. Her dream is to buy and sell clothing in bulk.

loans.use: To buy dresses, skirts, trousers and jackets.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, age 59, is married to Peter. She runs a beauty shop as her primary business but also owns a food stall.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD and she has successfully repaid the previous loan. She will use the funds to buy hair chemicals, weaves, dryers and a chips fryer. Jane hopes to open a restaurant and another beauty shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals, weaves and dryers

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro,de 77 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura de milpa,y crianza de pollos desde hace ya varios años el nos cuenta que con el credito anterior pudo comprar quimicos para la milpa,y animales esta muy contento porque tiene le oportunidad de un nuevo credito, ya que nos cuenta que nececita comprar mas semillas,abono para la milpa,y animales ya que el sueño de el es agrandar mas su negocio de animales y para eso requiere de mas capital,espera que Kiva le pueda dar ese apoyo que nececita,
texts.en:
Pedro is 77 and has been farming his fields and raising chickens for several years now. He tells us that with the previous loan he was able to buy chemicals for his fields, as well as animals. 

He is very happy because he has the opportunity for a new loan, as he tells us he needs to buy more seeds, fertilizer for his fields, as well as animals. His dream is to expand his livestock business, and for that he needs more capital. He hopes that Kiva can provide him with the support he needs.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for his fields, and animals to raise.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 34 years old. She sells thermos flasks, cups and plates to earn a living. She has been in the business for 13 years and has employed one person. To earn extra income she does maize farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy thermos flasks, cups, and plates for sale.

loans.use: To buy thermos flasks, cups, and plates for sale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco tiene 42 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos dependientes, reside junto a su familia en el anexo San Antonio de Padua del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona rural de pobladores bastante humildes dedicados principalmente a la agricultura y crianza de animales. Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. En su gran mayoría son ovejas en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Las alimenta de pastos naturales y cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le permiten solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia al sostenimiento de su economía. Francisco desea adquirir alimento balanceado, de modo que sus ovejas puedan criarse de mejor modo y pueda percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en: Francisco is 42, single and has no children that depend on him, he lives with his family next to San Antonio de Padua in the district of Lambayeque, a rural area populated by humble people that work mainly in agriculture and livestock production.  For four years he has worked breeding and selling livestock, in its majority sheep in an area located next to his home.  He feeds them with natural grass and when they have finished growing he offers them for sale to the clients that visit the area where he lives.  His income allows him to pay for personal expenses and help his family support their finances.  Francisco wishes to buy feed so his sheep can grow well and so he can earn more income through its sale.  As a result he thinks it's convenient to request Edpyme Alternativa a loan for 2000 new soles.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en:
Nicholus, aged 29, is married to Eunice who is a farmer and they are blessed with two children aged six and four. He sells motor spare parts and has been doing this for ten years. The business gives him a monthly income of Kshs.28,700.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the funds to buy more motor spare parts for sale. Nicholus hopes to open a wholesale shop for motor spare parts distribution in the future.

loans.use: To buy motor spare parts for sale

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en: Hisham is a 33-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and 6 children in Gaza. On 1st of January 2011 Hisham opened his mini market. He hopes through this loan to improve his market by purchasing shelves, an air conditioner, and a fridge. He will be able to expand his inventory and purchase in bulk, thus reducing his costs and allowing him to sell a wider variety of goods.

loans.use: to purchase shelves, an air conditioner, and a fridge

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 50 years old from Nyahururu and is married to Morris. They have three children who are in primary school.

Joyce has a retail business that she has been doing for years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD, to enable her to buy soaps, cooking oils, and soft drinks to add to her stock.

She hopes to grow her business and to diversify fully into farming.

loans.use: To buy soaps, cooking oils, and soft drinks

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 63 years old, married and has 6 children. He does dairy farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for 4 years and has employed 2 people. He does other farming to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 48 years old, married and has 2 children. He sells ropes to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to further expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy ropes to sell.

loans.use: to buy ropes to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a 52 year old business lady. She is married to Mbogo, who is also a business man. They are blessed with six children. Naomi has been selling second hand clothes for the past 15 years with a monthly income of KES 13,000, which she uses to support her family.

Naomi is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD., after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Naomi will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop in future.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 29 years old. She is married to Benson and together they have two children. She operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the past six months.

This is Priscilla's second loan from KADET LTD. She repaid her previous loan well and in good time. She will use the loan amount to finish her house, which she had earlier started.

Her dream is to develop her plot of land to own rental houses.

loans.use: to finish her house.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is 33 years old, married and has 2 children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 2 years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to further expand her business in the future. She has applied for 25,000 Kenya Shillings loan to buy sugar, rice, tea leaves and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, tea leaves and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Kalim

texts.en:
Kalim is 49 years old. She is married to Raphael, a business man. They are blessed with five children. She has been running a retail shop for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 5,450, which she uses to support her family.

Kalim is applying for her 3rd loan term with KADET LTD., after repaying the previous loans successfully. Kalim will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for her business.

loans.name: Ta-Wopaneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Ta-wopaneh” group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs are seeking for a loan of SLL 800,000.00, for each, in order to further expand the size and qualities of their respective businesses. 

Sayma is the leader of this group. The fifty-four-year-old is a native of Kambia, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a trader and the couple has 2 children attending primary school. Sayma sells used clothes and has been doing business for thirty years now. Sayma has requested for this loan in order to buy bales of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Word Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Word” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to request for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their respective businesses both in size and quality. 

Hawa is the leader of this group. The forty-two year old is a native of Mabanta. Hawa is married to a farmer and the couple has four children – one in secondary school and 3 in college. Hawa sells market food – palm-oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, etc. She has requested for this loan in order to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, margi, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Ta-Landeneh Group

texts.en:
Aminata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Makaley village, about thirty-nine years ago. She is married to a farmer and the couple has 4 children, 2 attending primary school and 2 in secondary school. 

For thirty years now, Aminata has been selling cloths. Specifically, Aminata sells “Bamako” cloths (popular ostentatious cloths dyed in Mali), etc. She has been doing business for ten years now. With the help of this loan, Aminata will buy a bale of Bamako cloths to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of Bamako cloths to add to her business.

loans.name: Learn To Pay Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city twenty-seven years ago. She is married to a motor-bike taxi driver and the couple has two children, 1 in primary school and 1 not yet of school going age. 

For 7 years now, Kadiatu has been selling market-food. With the help of this loan, she will be able to expand her businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on her living conditions. She will buy palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), salt, etc. in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy buy palm-oil, salt, etc. in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: Tonkolili Group

texts.en:
Isatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Isatu was born in Magburaka town, about forty years ago. She is married to a miner and the couple has 5 children. The children are attending primary and secondary schools. Isatu sells market-food and has been doing this business for fifteen years now.

With the help of this loan, Isatu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Isatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,000,000) to buy palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), salt, dried fish, etc. in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, salt, dried fish, etc. in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: Yonie Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in Yoni village in Northern Sierra Leone about thirty-seven years ago. She is married. The couple has 2 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Kadiatu sells ready-to-wear-clothes and has been doing this business for fifteen years now.

With the help of this loan, Kadiatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,000,000) to buy gara lapper making materials – ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc. in order to produce larger quantities, to add to her current selection.

loans.use: to buy gara lapper (dyed cloths) making materials – ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc. in order to produce a larger quantities of cloths.

loans.name: Cececial

texts.en:
Cececial is 48 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is married and has 6 children between the ages of 10 and 30. All of her children live at home and are in school. 

For the past 5 years, Cececial has been selling soft drinks, beer, eggs, and biscuits. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, beer, eggs, and biscuits for her business. She plans to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, bear, eggs, and biscuits for her business

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet Mariama from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. She is a local entrepreneur who has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 1,000,000. With the help of this loan she will be able to expand her business, make more sales and consequently improve on her living conditions. 

The thirty-seven-year-old was born in Freetown. She is married to a businessman and the couple has one child who is attending primary school. Mariama has been a businesswoman for many years now, she sells “gara lappers” (locally dyed cloths). With her loan, she will buy gara cloth making materials like ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc. for the production of a larger quantity of gara cloths to sell.

loans.use: to buy gara cloth making materials like ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc. for the production of a larger quantity of gara cloths to sell.

loans.name: Etoiles Plus Group

texts.en:
Jacquie, aged 47, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Etoiles Plus”. It is composed of 34 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Jacquie has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2002. She sells beans, and salted fish. Her business is located in the mid western part of Kinshasa. She is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having two times obtained and correctly repaid loans. With her next loan she is planning to diversify her business by buying 1 sack of rice, and 1-25liter container of vegetable oil to resell at a profit with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of US$30 per week. Jacquie’s ambition is to become a wholesaler. She is a widow and the mother of two children whose ages are 9 and 21 years old. Both of the children attend school.

loans.use: to diversify her business by buying 1 sack of rice, and 1 25 liter container of vegetable oil for resale at profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo tiene 37 años de edad, es casado hace 16 años, tiene 4 hijos de 15, 10, 12 y 5 años de edad y los tres mayores estudian, y  con los cuales vive en la Colonia Monte Verde de La Lopez, Choloma Cortes.
Reynaldo se dedica a una actividad que es la compra y venta de artículos en mal estado, (chatarras), botes y bolsas plásticas para reciclaje, también vende leña y aves como gallinas. Lleva 5 años dedicándose a este negocio el cual inicio por iniciativa propia.  El manifiesta que su negocio es rentable, el compra los lotes de estos materiales y los revende en las fabricas recicladoras. Trabaja desde las 7.00 am a 2.00 pm en esta actividad.
El préstamo que solicita es para comprar 2 lotes de materiales desechables para reciclar mayores de 2000 libras aproximadamente cada uno para la venta. De donde lograra obtener ingresos necesarios para el hogar y otros compromisos que actualmente tiene.
La meta que tiene a futuro es lograr obtener un vehículo para destinarlo a este negocio
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 37 years old and has been married for 16 years. He has four children who are 15, 12, 10, and 5 years old. The three oldest are in school and he lives with all of them in the Monte Verde community in La Lopez, Choloma, Cortes.

Reynaldo makes a living in the business of buying and selling salvaged materials (scrap), tubs and bags for recycling, in addition to selling firewood and poultry like chickens. He has made a living at this business for five years, which he started through his own efforts. He says that his business is profitable. He buys loads of these materials and resells them to recycling plants. He works from 7:00am to 2:00pm in this business. 

The loan he is requesting is for the purchase of two loads of more than 2,000 pounds each of salvaged materials to resell. He makes the necessary income for his home and other obligations he currently has through this business.

His goal for the future is to obtain a vehicle to use in his business.

loans.use: to buy two loads of salvaged materials.

location.town: Colonia Monte Verde, La Lopez, Choloma Cortes

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “God Bless” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. 

They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 700,000 each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Jariatu is the leader of this group. The twenty-six-year-old is married to a trader. Jariatu sells market-food and has been doing this business for many years now. She has applied for this loan in order to buy items like onions, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) and fish in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy items like onions, palm oil and fish in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is married with one child. She is 39 years old and resides in Pangabuan, Tangub City: Philippines. 

Analyn raises and sells pigs for a living and she's been in this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. In 2011, Analyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. 

In the future, Analyn wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is married and has five children. She is 34 years old and resides in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. 

Nilda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product line. 

Recently, Nilda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Nilda hopes to support the study of her children.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product line

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is from Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old. Rebecca is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Rebecca is running a general store, selling a variety of food and household products in the local community. Rebecca has been in her business for two years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Rebecca is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product line. This year, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product line

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is 44 years old and from the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. 

She has spent her life cultivating crops. She learned this skill from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has four school-aged children. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her. 

Growing crops is an annual activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Chea is looking for a loan to put towards purchasing fertilizers, gasoline and seeds for planting dry-season rice. She will use the rest of the funds to repair her old house, some parts of which are broken.

Chea hopes she will be able to develop her farming business by expanding the size of the rice crop plantation. She would also like to enlarge her old house and support her children in studying towards a high degree of education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, gasoline and seeds for planting dry-season rice.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 32 years old with one child. She lives in Pangabuan, Tangub City: Philippines. 

Marilou owns and operates a piggery business venture and she's been in this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. 

In 2009, Marilou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Positively, she simply hopes to improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Munhzul

texts.en:
Munhzul is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province in Western Mongolia. His wife is a shop assistant. His oldest daughter is a college student and the next oldest daughter is a high school student. 

He has been running a food store business since 2004. He brings the supplies from the city and his wife works there. This is the only source of finance for the family members and they have many regular customers, who appreciate the goods and the service. 

Munhzul is a bright man, who says that "I would like to expand my business by getting the supplies in large quantities, so that I could save more for the family needs, especially for my daughters college tuition fees". 

The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to purchase the food store supplies.

loans.use: To purchase food store supplies

loans.name: Edelina

texts.en:
Edelina is married and has children. She is 45 years old and lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. 

Edelina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been in this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product line. 

Recently, Edelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Edelina hopes to improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product line

loans.name: Jose Damian

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, ya que está iniciando la temporada de sembrar, para esto necesita arrendar el terreno y la compra de abono, para poder realizar el cultivo de maíz y frijol.
El considera que estos préstamos le han servido para desarrollar su trabajo con mayor facilidad y ha recibido muy buenos resultados, ayudando a su familia para estar mejor.
texts.en:
José has decided to request a new loan since the planting season is beginning and he needs to rent land and buy fertilizer for his corn and bean crops.

He believes the loans have helped him carry out his work more easily, and he has obtained good results which contribute toward a better lifestyle for his family.

loans.use: To rent land and buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Brenda Esmeralda

texts.es:
Brenda, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de productos para el negocio, invertirá en plátanos, yuca, repollo, aceite,  para la venta de meriendas,  esta compra le ayudara para mantener el negocio y el nivel de ventas.
Ella considera que su condición económica ha mejorado, a través del buen uso de los fondos del préstamo.
texts.en: Brenda is requesting a new loan to buy products for her business, such as bananas, yucca plant, cabbage and oil to prepare afternoon snacks.  This purchase will help keep the business going while maintaining its sales volume.  She believes her economic situation has improved through the proper use of the loan funds.

loans.use: To buy bananas, yucca plant, cabbage and oil.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: El Sr. Simón tiene  es casado con 5 hijos que tiene la edad de  17-22, 26,  18 y 14 años, se dedica a la venta de joyas en su joyería que se encuentran ubicado en la zona de San Antonio,  este préstamo es la segunda secuencia dentro de la institución,  simón utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de joyas, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para comprar oro y plata, el Sr. Simón enfrenta retos en su negocio que son los precios bajos  de la competencia. Y seguirá utilizando los beneficios en el crecimiento del negocio. En Sr.  Simón desea tener una mayor cantidad de clientes y así generar mas ingresos, mejorar su vivienda  y agrandar su casa.
texts.en: Simón is married and has five children, ages 26, 22, 18, 17 and 14.  He has a jewelry business in the area of San Antonio.  This is his second loan through the institution.  He plans to use the loan to buy raw materials, such as gold and silver, to make jewelry.  The challenges he faces in his business are the low prices offered by competitors.  He plans to continue investing his profits in expanding the business, as Simón wants to reach more customers and generate more income so he can improve and expand his house.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make jewelry.

loans.name: Jose Eusebio

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que quiere continuar brindando un buen servicio, ella comprara mariscos variados, como pescado de diferentes clases, camarones, conchas, y de otras clases necesarias para la venta.
El considera que trabajando con préstamos lograra crecer, ganarse más clientela y tener mejores condiciones para ofrecer a su familia.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan so he can provide better service by offering varied seafood and different kinds of fish, shrimp, molluscs and other types he feels he needs to sell.

He believes that by working with the loans he will be able to expand his business and reach more customers, which will improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fish, shrimp and molluscs.

loans.name: Telma Yanira

texts.es:
Telma, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para darle continuidad al fortalecimiento del negocio, comprando ropa nueva, como blusas, faldas, pantalones, para ofrecer a los clientes y así mantener la preferencia.
Ella se mantiene con su negocio, considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho y que seguirá invirtiendo para crecer en el mercado.
texts.en:
Telma is requesting a new loan to continue strengthening her business.  She will buy new clothes, such as blouses, skirts and trousers to offer to her customers to maintain their loyalty.

She is still active in her business and believe the previous loan helped her greatly.  She will continue investing to expand in the market.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts and trousers.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo, cuenta con casa propia en la cual vive junto a su esposo, el caserío donde vive se llama “Sialupe” y esta ubicado a unos 30 minutos del Distrito de Lambayeque y el mismo a unos 20 minutos de la Ciudad de Chiclayo. En su caserío ellos son considerados personas de trabajo y muy responsables.

Felicita siempre ha sido una mujer  trabajadora y es por eso que hasta la fecha se dedica a la crianza, engorde y comercialización de animales menores como, ovinos, caprinos y aves de corral, los cría en corrales instalados en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales están construidos de material rustico (carrizo, adobe, y barro), y los alimenta con pastos naturales y alimentos balanceados, hasta que alcancen el peso y tamaño ideal para venderlos a los mercados cercanos a su caserío. Su esposo comparte sus labores diarias en la crianza y también trabaja como estibador en un molino de la zona generando ingresos que ayudan al sustento familiar.

Esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 3000 Nuevos Soles, con el fin de comprar alimento balanceado y el mejoramiento de sus corrales debido a que las constantes lluvias han deteriorado.
texts.en:
Felicita is 28 years old, married, and has one child.  She owns her own home where she lives together with her husband.  The small village in which she lives is called Sialupe and it is located some 30 minutes from Lambayeque district which is, in turn, some 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  The people in Felicita's village are considered to be hard-working and very responsible people.

Felicita has always been a hard-working woman and she works raising, fattening and selling animals such as sheep, goats and barnyard birds.  She raises her animals in pens located behind her home.  The pens are built from materials such as reeds, adobe and mud.  She feeds her animals with natural fodder and nutritionally-balanced feed until they reach an ideal size and weight to be sold in the markets near her village.  Her husband shares the daily tasks involved in raising the animals and also works as a loader at a local mill, making income to help support their family.

Felicita is requesting a loan for 3,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy nutritionally-balanced feed and to improve her pens because, owing to the constant rains, their condition has deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed and to improve her pens

loans.name: Emigdio De Jesus

texts.es:
Emigdio, se decidió por solicitar un préstamo, a consecuencia del buen trabajo que realizo con el anterior, comprara en esta ocasión cerdos para comercializarlos, esta inversión le ayudara para mantener la granja y poder continuar generando ventas.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho en la agrcultura, por el momento no ha enfrentado problemas y que su condición es más estable junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Emigdio has decided to request a new loan as a result of the good work that he managed with his previous loan.  On this occasion he will buy pigs to sell.  This investment will help him to maintain his farm and continue making sales.

Emigdio considers the previous loan to have helped him a lot in his farming.  Up to now he hasn't faced any problems and he and his family find themselves in a more stable position.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, tiene la necesidad de un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo en la agricultura y ganadería, porque comprara abono y herbicidas, tambien una novilla y dos cerdos, este préstamo será de mucha ayuda para Miguel, ya que comprara los insumos necesarios para sembrar maíz además de crecer en su granja.
Él manifiesta estar en mejores condiciones con las inversiones que realiza, ya que los préstamos le dan el dinero para invertirlo y poder generar ganancias para la familia.
texts.en:
Miguel needs a new loan to invest in his farming and livestock business.  He will buy fertilizer and herbicides, as well as a heifer and two pigs.  This loan will help him a lot as he will be able to buy the supplies he needs to sow his corn and also grow his farm.

Miguel says that he is in a better position as a result of the investments that he makes.  The loans give him the money he needs to invest and he is able to make profit for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a heifer and two pigs

loans.name: Mario Rene

texts.es:
Mario, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo, para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, ladrillo, arena, pintura, para darle una mejora apariencia a la vivienda, esta compra espera que sea de provecho al igual que el préstamo anterior, con la diferencia que el préstamo lo invirtió en compra de productos para la tienda.
Él considera que ha tenido una buena experiencia con el negocio y con el trabajo de los préstamos, viviendo más solvente en la actualidad.
texts.en:
Mario is requesting a new loan to buy construction supplies such as cement, bricks, sand and paint so that he can improve the appearance of his home.  He hopes that this purchase will be as beneficial as the one he made with his previous loan.  The difference is that he invested his previous loan in buying products for his store.

Mario believes that he has had a good experience with his business and working with loans.  As a result, he is currently more solvent.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand and paint

loans.name: Santos Del Carmen

texts.es:
Santos, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de calzado para surtir el negocio, adquiriendo calzado escolar y casual, para atender a los clientes en sus necesidades de calzar bien.
Ella considera que estos préstamos le permiten mejorar el negocio, crecer en el inventario para tener disponibilidad en el negocio.
texts.en:
Santos is requesting a new loan to buy footwear with which to stock her business.  She will buy school shoes and casual shoes so that she can meet her customers' footwear needs. 

Santos believes that these loans allow her to improve her business and increase her stock so that she has merchandise available in her business.

loans.use: to buy school shoes and casual shoes

loans.name: Jose Emilio

texts.es:
José, tiene la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en su actividad agrícola, pues está iniciando la nueva siembra y necesita contratar el alquiler del terreno, ya que esto le permite tener mayor productividad, sembrando en terrenos amplios.
Él considera que estos préstamos le ayudan para crecer y tener la oportunidad de realizar su trabajo, ya que le facilita los recursos para asegurarse de la tierra.
texts.en:
José needs to continue investing in his farming business as he is starting a new sowing season and he needs to rent his land.  This allows him to be more productive, growing crops on a lot of land.  

José believes that these loans help him to grow and give him the opportunity to carry out his work as they give him the resources he needs to guarantee the land.

loans.use: to pay to rent some land

loans.name: Transito Edenilson

texts.es:
Transito, se ha decido por un nuevo préstamo, para fortalecer el negocio, ya que considera que estos financiamientos le dan mayor rentabilidad al negocio, él comprara tres terneros, ya que él los comercializa cuando están crecidos.
Él manifiesta haber tenido una buena experiencia con el préstamo anterior, ayudando al negocio y a su familia, con las mejoras en las ganancias.
texts.en:
Transito has decided to request a new loan to strengthen his business as he believes that these loans make his business more profitable.  He will buy three calves which he will sell when they have grown.

Transito reports that he had a good experience with his previous loan and that the improved profits helped his business and his family.

loans.use: to buy three calves

loans.name: Dolores Patricia

texts.es:
Dolores, quiere seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de ropa para damas y caballeros, como blusas, pantalones y ropa para niños, ella con su préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, ya que le incremento la mercadería y sus ganancias fueron mayores.
Dolores espera que este prestamo le ayudara para darle continuidad a su ventas y atender la clientela con ropa nueva.
texts.en:
Dolores would like to continue investing in her business.  For this reason, she is requesting a new loan to buy ladies' and men's clothing such as blouses and pants, and children's clothing.  Her previous loan had a positive effect as she increased her merchandise and made more profits.

Dolores hopes that this loan will help her to enjoy continuity in her sales and serve her customers with new clothing.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants and children's clothing

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de productos para el negocio, pues lo quiere surtir y ofrecer a la clientela mayores productos, como bebidas (gaseosas, jugos), frutas, verduras, condimentos, aceite, carnes para preparar comida, hamburguesas y otros productos que según la demanda de los clientes, así ella les ofrece.
Estos préstamos María considera que le ayudan para mantenerse activa, con el negocio fortalecido para mantener a su familia, sobre todo aquellas necesidades más urgentes.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan to buy products for her business as she wants to stock her business and offer her customers more products.  She will buy drinks (soda and juice), fruit, vegetables, seasonings, oil and meat for preparing her food, hamburgers and other products that her customers request.

María believes that these loans help her to remain active and strengthen her business so that she can support her family, above all their most urgent needs.

loans.use: to buy drinks (soda and juice), fruit, vegetables, seasonings and oil

loans.name: Moun

texts.en:
Moun, age 52, is a domestic farmer who usually works on a rice field that is located in the Baray district of Kompong Tom. She is able to earn a small profit from her daily business. With another financial source, she also raised some piglets for selling. 

Her husband is a firewood seller in his community, making an average income of about USD 5.00 per day. He always used his buffalo to connect with his existing trailer for selling his items, but now one of his buffalo is too old to pull the trailer any longer. Moun decided to look for a loan fund from Kiva in order to purchase a new buffalo for her husband. With this loan, Moun’s spouse will still go on with his business as usual and it will not effect their daily income.

The couple has four children, two of whom are single and still learning in a local school, while the remaining two are married and living in their own houses.

loans.use: to purchase a new buffalo for her husband.

loans.name: Santos Joel

texts.es:
Santos tiene 30 años de edad, el es casado, tiene 02 hijos menores de edad, cuenta con casa propia la cuala está ubicada en el caserío Valle Nuevo en el distrito de Mochumi a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Santos se dedica a la comercialización de animales menores, en variedad como aves gallinas, pavos, patos, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, este negocio lo desarrolla en el Mercado central o en los distintos caseríos cercanos a Mochumi. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace mas de 6 años, en los que a adquirido experiencia en el rubro y clientela fija a su negocio. 
Y adicionalmente también se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros en un vehiculo menor (mototxy) que adquirió producto de su trabajo Santos está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para el engorde de sus aves, con el préstamo comprara alimento para dichos animales y dar mantenimiento al motor de su vehiculo.

Santos es una persona emprendedora y responsable, el desea poder crecer como empresario y poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is 30 years old, married, and has two dependent children.  He owns his own home which is located in the small village of Valle Nuevo, in Mochumi district, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Santos' business is selling birds such as hens, turkeys and ducks.  He raises his animals in pens which are located behind his home.  He sells his animals in the central market or in villages near Mochumi.  He has been in this business for more than six years and has gained both experience and regular customers for his business.  In addition, Santos also provides a passenger transport service with a motorcycle taxi that he acquired through his work.  

Santos is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to fatten his birds.  He will use his loan to buy feed for the animals.  He will also have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle's engine.

Santos is an entrepreneurial and responsible person who would like to grow as a businessman and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed and to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle

loans.name: Jose Lucio

texts.es:
José, continua realizando sus labores de agricultura, por eso está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para la compra de materiales como el abono, herbicidas, semilla mejorada, para poder realizar su actividad.
Él considera que estos préstamos le han ayudado para mejorar la productividad en sus tierras, teniendo oportunidad para que sus cosechas sean más abundantes y sanas, esto tambien contribuye a los ingresos de la familia.
texts.en:
José continues with his farming activities. This is why he is requesting a new loan to buy materials such as compost, herbicides and improved grains to be able to carry out this activity.

He believes that these loan have helped him to improve his lands' productivity, as they have provided the opportunity for his yields to be more abundant and healthier. This also contributes to the family income.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides and improved grains.

loans.name: Elsy Noemy

texts.es:
Elsy, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de productos para el negocio como el maíz, la leña,  ya que es su materia prima para poder realizar la venta de tortillas, estos préstamos le han ayudado a mejorar su situación y poder atender a los clientes.
Ella considera que su negocio y su condición de vida son mucho mejor ahora que anterior a los préstamos, porque cuenta con lo necesario para la elaboracion de la tortillas.
texts.en:
Elsy is requesting a new loan to buy products for her business such as corn and firewood, as these are the raw materials she needs to be able to sell tortillas. These loans have helped her to improve her situation and to be able to serve her customers.

She believes that her business and her living conditions are now much better than before she had the loans, because she now has the necessary to make tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: El Sr. Leandro tiene 53 años y es casado con 3 hijos que son de las edades de 21, 17, 10 años, todos se encuentran estudiando, el Sr. Leandro es este momento se dedica a la  elaboración de pan desde tempranas horas de la mañana, luego los vende en su tienda de barrio este préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de insumos para su negocio como azúcar, harina y levadura, es la segunda secuencia del crédito que tiene dentro de la institución con un buen comportamiento de pago, se  encuentra muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo y la confianza que recibe,  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son de ampliar en la atención a nuevos mercados, por que el cliente es conocido por la zona, utilizara los beneficios del crédito en la mejora de sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, sueña que en un futuro su  negocio cuente con una mayor ampliación y cobertura de mercado.
texts.en: Leandro is 53 years old, married, and has three children aged 21, 17 and 10 who are all studying.  Starting very early in the morning, Leandro makes bread which he then sells in his neighborhood store.  He will use this loan to buy supplies for his business such as sugar, flour and yeast.  This is his second loan cycle with the institution and he has a good repayment record.  He is very grateful to the institution for their support and the trust that they place in him.  He faces challenges in his business such as expanding to reach new markets as he is well known in his area.  Leandro will use the loan to improve his income and also his family's quality of life.  He dreams of his business expanding and being able to cover a larger market in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour and sugar

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque considera que son de mucha ayuda para ella, dándole la oportunidad de invertir en el negocio y poder seguir generando ventas, con esta deuda comprara leche para elaborar los productos como la cuajada y crema.
Ella manifiesta haber tenido una buena experiencia con el préstamo anterior, que ha trabajado bien en todo este periodo, comprando leche al mayoreo y produciendo los lacteos.
texts.en:
Rosibel is requesting a new loan because she believes that they help her a lot, giving her the opportunity to invest in her business and to be able to continue generating sales. With this loan she will buy milk in order to make products such as cuajada [curd] and cream.

She claims that she has had a good experience with her previous loan, that she worked well throughout the whole period, buying milk wholesale and producing dairy products.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Maria Elsi

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de productos para el negocio, como quesillo, carne, aceite, chicharrón, harina, para mantener en su negocio, esto le ayudara para que sus clientes tengan una mejor atención.
Ella está consciente de que estos préstamos le han ayudado para mejorar la condición económica de su hogar, porque las ventas han aumentado.
texts.en:
Maria is requesting a new loan in order to buy products for her business such as cheese, meat, oil, crackling and flour. These products will keep her in business and will help her to provide a better service to her customers.

She is aware of the fact that these loans have helped her to improve the economical situation of her home as her sales have increased.

loans.use: to buy cheese, meat, oil, crackling, flour.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para fortalecimiento del negocio, ya que quiere mantenerse en la buena atención a los clientes, comprara ropa (blusas, faldas, vestidos) y tambien comprara plásticos, esta inversión es importante para su negocio, permitiéndole continuar en su ventas.
El considera que el trabajo con estos préstamos le ayuda para mejorar sus condiciones familiares y le da crecimiento en el mercado.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is requesting a new loan to strengthen his business as he would like to continue providing his customers with a good service.  He will buy clothing (blouses, skirts and dresses) and also plastic products.  This investment is important for his business and allows him to continue making his sales.

Rodolfo believes that these loans help him to improve his family's situation and help him grow in the market.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, dresses and plastic products

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo, para hacer crecer más el negocio, comprara mariscos frescos, con este efectivo podrá tener  más disponibilidad para realizar compras periódicas ya que este producto tiende a dañarse, por tal razón comprara por partes (pescado freso y seco, langostas, camarones).
Ella considera que este aporte de los préstamos  le ha ayudado a mantenerse activa en el mercado.
texts.en:
Juana has decided to request a new loan to further grow her business.  She will buy fresh seafood.  This cash will enable her to make periodic purchases which are necessary as this type of product tends to go bad.  She will buy fresh and dried fish, lobster and shrimp in more than one purchase.

Juana believes that these loans have helped her to remain active in the market.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, lobster and shrimp

loans.name: Tatiana Lizbeth

texts.es:
Tatiana, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere seguir invirtiendo en el negocio comprando un surtido en perfumería, lociones y cremas aromáticas, para poder mejorar la atención a los clientes, ya que asi el negocio contara con nuevos estilos y olores de lociones y cremas.
Ella considera que a través de los préstamos ha tenido mayores oportunidades de desarrollo y crecimiento económico.
texts.en:
Tatiana is requesting a new loan because she would like to continue investing in her business, buying perfumes, lotions and fragrant creams.  This will improve her service to her customers as her business will have new types and fragrances of lotions and creams.

Tatiana believes that these loans have given her more opportunities to develop and grow financially.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions and fragrant creams

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Patricia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de productos de primera necesidad como boquitas, galletas, gaseosas, embutidos, huevos, pastas, para surtir el negocio, ya que esto le permite mejorar la atención al cliente y poder seguir generando ingresos para la familia.
Ella considera que este aporte le ayuda para que la condición del negocio sea más favorable, logrando tener mayores ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Patricia is requesting a new loan in order to buy staple products such as snacks, biscuits, sodas, cold meats, eggs and pasta. These products will allow her to stock her store, which will improve her customer service and she will be able to continue generating income for her family.

She believes that this support helps her to improve the condition of her business, bringing in more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy snacks, biscuits, sodas, cold meats, eggs and pasta.

loans.name: Dania Olandina

texts.es:
La  joven  Dania  se dedica a su negocio Venta  de  ropa  nueva como ser, camisas, pantalones, faldas, short, ropa para niños entre otros, todos los días ella instala una carpa frente del  parque  central,  desde hace mas  de 8 años, atiende a partir de las 9:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm, los días de Lunes a Sábado. Es madre  de  3  hijos  los  cuales  están estudiando en  la  escuela  de  su  comunidad, cuenta con la ayuda de su  esposo  que  se  dedica al  comercio y juntos han logrado salir adelante con sus obligaciones.

Esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 25,000.00 para invertirlo en la compra de variedad de ropa nueva, Su tiempo libre lo dedica  disfrutar con su familia.
texts.en:
Dania is a young woman whose business is selling new clothing such as shirts, pants, skirts, shorts, children's clothes, etc.  Every day she sets up her awning opposite the central park where she has been working for more than eight years.  She serves her customers from 9.00am to 6.00pm, from Monday to Saturday.  Dania is the mother of three children who are attending school in her community.  She has the support of her husband who is a salesman.  Together the couple have managed to meet their obligations.

Dania is requesting a loan for 25,000 lempira so that she can invest in buying a variety of new clothing.  In her free time, she enjoys spending time with her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shirts, blouses, dresses, skirts and pants

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of fruits to sell for her fruit business.

Angelita has been in this business for eight years. Angelita earns more income from fishing.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anna Liza

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Anna Liza works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store. Anna Liza is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Anna Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is married. She is 43 years old and lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Merlinda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products. She has been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP for doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell in her store. Recently, Merlinda joined GDMPC. In the future, Merlinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Twunguranibitekerezo / Rhh Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel fait partie du groupe Twunguranibitekerezo/Rhh. Il a 42 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 3 mois à 17 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de primaire.

Emmanuel est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Emmanuel voudrait être un grossiste. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser et soigner ses enfants et sa famille.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is a member of the group Twunguranibitekerezo/Rhh. He is 42 years old and married with six children aged 3 months to 17 years old. Three of the children are in school. He himself attended three years of primary school. 

Emmanuel is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB, and he plans to use the funds to buy chemical fertilizers. 

His business growth strategy is to use selected chemical fertilizers. In the coming years, he would like to become a wholesaler. He plans to use his profits to provide for his family’s healthcare and his children’s tuition.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity.

loans.name: Flor De Caña Group

texts.es:
La señora Yanet es uno de los miembros de el Grupo Flor de Caña el cual esta integrado por 4 mujeres cada una de ellas realiza una actividad económica para poder ayudar a sus esposo a sacar adelante a sus familias, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una comunidad la cual se caracteriza por que sus gente es muy trabajadora y como ahí hay una laguna la mayoría de las familias se dedican a la pesca.

Doña Yanet tiene la edad de 27 años, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casada con el señor Freddy que trabaja como jornalero, ellos tienen dos hijos Ingrit de 9 años y Jamil de 8 años ambos estudian la primaria en su comunidad. La señora Yanet nos platica que hace un poco mas de 6 años decidió iniciar a trabajar y con el apoyo de su esposo abrió una pequeña papelería para poder ayudarlo con los gastos de su hogar. Ella tiene su negocio en un local junto a su casa y abre todos los dias de ocho de la mañana a ocho de la noche y nos dice que gracias a Dios su negocio a tenido exito y poco a poco lo ha hecho crecer invirtiendo mas en su negocio y actualmente tambien vende regalos. 

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de de hojas blancas, lapiz, lapiceros, colores, plastilina, cartulinas y regalos para resurtir su negocio.

ella desea que con esta inversión su negocio continué progresando ya que desea que sus hijos en un futuro tengan la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son:
 teresa que vende mojarra 
Maria de pilar que vende calzado 
y Teresa que vende Mojarra y carne enchilada
texts.en:
Yanet is one of the members of the group Flor de Caña, which is formed of four women. Each of them carry out a business activity in order to help their husbands get their families ahead. This group is located in a community which is known for its hard working people. As there is a lagoon there, the majority of its families make a living fishing.

Yanet is 27 years old. She only studied up to secondary level and is married to Freddy, who works as a day labourer. They have two children; Ingrit, who is 9 and Jamil, who is 8. Both study at primary school in their community. Yanet tells us that a little over six years ago she decided to start working and with the support of her husband opened a small paper shop to be able to help with the household bills. She has her shop in a building next to her house and she opens every day from 8 in the morning until 8 at night. She says that thanks to God her business has been successful and little by little she has made it grow by investing more into her business. Presently, she also sells gifts.

She needs this loan in order to invest in buying white paper, pencils, pens, colours, plasticine, card and gifts to stock her shop.

She hopes that with this investment her business will continue progressing, as she wants her children to have the opportunity to study a professional career in the future.

The other members of this group are:

Teresa, who sells mojarra [bream]
Maria del pilar who sells footwear
and Teresa who sells bream and beef enchilada

loans.use: to buy white paper, pencils, pens, colours, plasticine, card and gifts.

loans.name: Zonia Aida

texts.es:
Zonia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de materiales como leña, maíz, aceite, condimentos, todo esto para la venta de antojitos, este préstamo le ayudara para mantener en su cocina lo necesario y poder continuar elaborando sus ricos platillos.
La condición del negocio de Zonia ha mejorado, cubriendo la mayor parte de las necesidades y teniendo más estabilidad, todo por la utilizacion de estos prestamos.
texts.en:
Zonia is requesting a new loan to buy materials such as firewood, corn, oil and seasonings for making the snacks which she sells.  This loan will help her to have what she needs for her cooking and will enable her to continue making her delicious dishes.

Zonia's business conditions have improved.  She is able to cover most of her needs and has more stability as a result of using these loans.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, oil and seasonings

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, se ha decidido por un nuevo para el fortalecimiento del negocio, esto le ayudara para comprarse verduras frescas como papas, güisquiles, zanahorias, tomates, además de materiales para hacer refrescos como morro, canela, maní, ajonjolí, este préstamo considera que le ayudara para mantenerse en el negocio.
Ella manifiesta que el trabajar con la institución y cancelar bien los préstamos, le ha dado la oportunidad de tener una fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria has decided to take out a new loan to strengthen her business.  This will help her to buy fresh vegetables such as potatoes, chayote (squash), carrots and tomatoes.  She will also buy materials that she needs to make drinks such as cinnamon, peanuts and sesame.  She believes that this loan will help her to remain in her business.

Gloria says that working with the institution and repaying her loans on time has given her the opportunity to have a source of income for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, chayotes, carrots and tomatoes

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
From the Prey Chor district, Khoeurn, age 52, is a local farmer who has been farming for years. He is married and is currently planting a variety of crops to earn a living. This couple has seven children, three of whom are single and the rest are married and live separately around the province. 

Khoeurn will use this Kiva loan to mend his old house. Khoeurn wishes to purchase a few farmlands so he can grow his crop-growing business and  rebuild a comfortable house for him and his family members to live in. He also wants to support his children so they can study at a high level.

loans.use: to mend his old house.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 36 years old and married with six children.

Annabelle works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Annabelle has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from renting out billiard tables.

Annabelle aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 32 years old with 1 child. She lives in Pangabuan, Tangub City, Philippines. Elizabeth owns and operates a hog raising business venture and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she gets 5,000 PHP doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. In 2011, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She simply hopes for business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 28 years old and married with one child who is in school. Emelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Emelyn runs a spice retail business in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional spices to sell. Emelyn has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Emelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily works hard to support her family. Emily is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Emily requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for fishing.  Emily has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Emily would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for fishing

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun is a single mother of six children living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She has worked as a local rice cultivator for many years, generating around 1.50 USD per day. She has 6 children: 3 are married and 3 are single. Presently some of them are employed in different careers and workplaces. But they always share a part of their income to help the family with its daily expenses. 

Now Chhun is taking out this loan from HKL in order to purchase piglets, feed and to build a new pigpen. For her plan, Chhun will strive to work harder to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and to build a new pigpen

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 51 years old and married with 6 children. With one child in school, Gilda works very hard to provide for them.
