Se dedica exclusivamente a la crianza, engorde y comercialización de animales menores como ovinos, caprinos, y aves de corral, los cuales vende a los comerciantes de los mercados mas cercanos, además también cuenta con 1has de terreno agrícola herencia de su padre en el cual ha sembrado limón y cosecha semanalmente, en ambos negocios cuenta ya con su clientela, a quienes visita semanalmente para la entrega de sus productos.
Con miras a mejorar sus condiciones de vida ahora están solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles, los cuales serán utilizados para la compra de alimento balanceado y pueda generar un mejor engorde y mas rápido crecimiento de su ganado para poder ofrecerlos a mejores precios, y la compra de fertilizantes para el abono de su sembrios,  y con las utilidades que obtenga pueda cumplir con sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Emilio is a very responsible, 44-year-old father of three children.  He lives with his wife in a house that’s his property located in the rural settlement called “Peñarol” that belongs to Tambogrande District in Piura over four hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

He works exclusively raising and selling minor livestock like sheep, goats and barnyard fowl that he sells to merchants in the nearest markets.  He also has a one hectare parcel of farmland that he inherited from his father where he grows lemons that are harvested weekly.  Both businesses have established clientele who he visits weekly to deliver his products.

Aiming to improve his living conditions, he’s asking Edpyme Alternative for a 1000 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed that will result in better fattening up and more rapid growth of his livestock so that he can sell it at better prices.  The purchase of fertilizer is for his crops and he will use profits obtained to meet his objectives.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ma. Nena

texts.en:
Ma. Nena is 47-years-old and married with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Nena runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Ma. Nena has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, milk, sugar, spices, soft drinks, snack foods, etc.. 

In the future Ma. Nena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is 31-years-old, married and has one child. He has a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and has employed one person. 

To earn extra income he does maize farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorcycle to use in his business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to use in his business.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 50-years-old and married with 3 children.

Nelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Nelia has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Nelia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura tiene 49 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposo en casa la cual es de su propiedad, su casa esta ubicada en el distrito de la Matanza en la provincia de Morropón en Piura, en su distrito normalmente se dedican a la agricultura y comercio de ganado.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega que se encuentra instalada en su domicilio. Ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario, los cuales prefieren su negocio debido a que siempre encuentran productos de calidad y son atendidos amablemente. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia. Adicionalmente también en la parte posterior de su domicilio cría, animales menores en su gran mayoría son aves de corral, las que ofrece a sus vecinos cada vez que hay festividades.

Rosaura desea ampliar su bodega adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 508 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Rosaura is 49 years old, married and has three children.  She lives with her husband in a house they own.  Her house is located in La Matanza District in Morropón Province in Piura.  Her district’s usual activities are farming and livestock commerce.

She sells basic staple items and groceries in a home-based store.   She provides her customers with daily use items.  They prefer her store because they always find quality items and receive kind treatment.  She uses income earned from this activity to help her husband support their family.  In addition, she also raises small farm animals, mostly barnyard fowl, in her back yard that she sells to her neighbors whenever there are festivities.

Rosaura wants to expand her store acquiring more products so that she can meet present demand and this is why she’s though it advisable to request a 508 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach her objectives.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items in larger amounts.

loans.name: Maria Fortunata

texts.es: Maria tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Pacora en Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 10 años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Cría los animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimentos balanceados. Desea obtener un mejor peso y tamaño de sus animales para venderlos a un mejor precio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con esta inversión, espera ampliar su negocio para poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para seguir apoyando a su esposo en solventar los gastos familiares. Maria es un cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa y cumplió con sus obligaciones puntualmente. Y también cuenta con buenas referencias de sus vecinos y sus clientes por ser muy cumplida con sus compromisos comerciales.
texts.en:
María, aged 42, is married and the mother of three children. She lives in her own house in the rural area of the district of Pacora in the province of Lambayeque. She has been breeding and selling small animals for over ten years. She keeps the animals in the backyard of her house, and when they reach an appropriate weight she sells them to the general public and to merchants who come to her area.

María wants to expand her business by buying more animals and balanced feed. She wants that her animals reach a better weight and size in order to sell them at a higher price. Therefore she thought that she should take out a loan of 2000 new soles from the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa. Thanks to this investment she hopes to expand her business and earn enough profit to continue to support her husband with household expenses. María is a long-standing client of Edpyme Alternativa and has always been punctual with her repayments. In addition, she has good references from her neighbors and customers, because she is very reliable in her business commitments.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and small animals to breed.

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is a 26-year-old married woman. She has 3 children and all 3 are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Karisa and he works as a tailor. 

Mwenda operates a retail shop business and sells her goods in the shop. She's worked in this business for 2 years and was previously employed as a farmer. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwenda will use the Kes 20000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, detergents, and cooking fat oil. Mwenda aspires to establish a retail shop business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, detergents, cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 5 children between the ages of 10 and 1 and 3 are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Emanuel. 

Jane operates a retail shop business and sells her goods in the shop. She's worked in this business for 1 year. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Jane's other source of income includes her husband's income. 

She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Jane will use the Kes 45,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, detergents, and cooking fat oil. Jane aspires to expand her retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, detergents, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Clara Cristina

texts.es: Clara Cristina de treinta años de edad vive con su hijo; ella se dedica al alquiler de sillas es muy conocida en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente, pues la gente siempre queda satisfecha con la calidad de sus servicios además el precio es muy accesible; Clara es una mujer honrada, activa y muy dedicada a su labor, siempre dispuesta a aprovechar todas las oportunidades que se presenten y cumplir todas sus metas, piensa que para llegar a la cima no se llega superando a los demás, sino superándose a sí mismo, quiere superarse y salir adelante es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar sillas y  mesas de plástico para aumentar el negocio y algunas mas de metal. Clara Cristina tiene la esperanza que así podrá mejorar su condición de vida y familia
texts.en:
Clara Cristina, 30, lives with her son.  She rents chairs.  She’s very well known in her zone and has lately acquired quite a few customers because people are always satisfied with the quality of her service and her prices are accessible.  

Clara is an honest, active woman who is very dedicated to her work.  She’s always determined to take advantage of opportunities that arise and reach all her goals.  She thinks that one does not reach the summit by being better than others but rather by improving oneself.  She wants to improve herself and get ahead which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy plastic and some metal chairs and tables to increase business.  Clara Cristina hopes to thus improve her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy plastic tables and chairs.

loans.name: Kuir

texts.en: Kuir lives in the town of Bor, where she has earned a living for the last four years by selling charcoal. She is 30 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is still in school. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and is now requesting her fourth loan from BRAC, for SDG 2,000, in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marco, vive en la ciudad de Choluteca con su esposa e hijo,  es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicado a su negocio Compra y venta de ganado,  actividad que realiza desde hace 12 años, sus ventas ya son por encargo a clientes que vienen de San Lorenzo, San Marcos y alrededores, desde hace varios años, es muy responsable y honrado de buenos principios morales y religiosos,  cada día que pasa trabaja muy fuerte  para ir creciendo y llegar a tener una vida mejor para el y su familia. Esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 15,000.00 para invertirlo en la compra de ganado.
texts.en: Marco lives in the city of Choluteca with his wife and son.  He's a very hardworking person who is dedicated to his business buying and selling cattle, an activity he's been in for 12 years.  His sales are based on orders from customers who live in San Lorenzo, San Marcos and surrounding areas.  He's been in business for several years.  He's very responsible and honest and has good moral and religious principles.  Every day that goes buy he works very hard to grow and to have a better life for him and his family.  He's asking for a loan valued at L.15,000.oo to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Doña Maria  Elena tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos con edades de 18, 15, 12 y 8 años, de los cuales solo uno de ellos estudia y vive con sus hijos en la Aldea el Edén de Peña Blanca, Cortes.
Doña Maria hace 11 años se dedica al negocio de venta de vanidades como, (cremas para cuerpo, lociones, shampoo y variedad de cosméticos). Este negocio lo estableció con la necesidad de tener sus propios ingresos para poder mantener a sus hijos siendo madre soltera ha trabajado mucho. Su mercadería la vende de forma ambulante en las comunidades vecinas. Manifiesta que ha tenido muy buenas ganancias las cuales le han ayudado a seguir reinvirtiendo en sus productos. Ella dedica a vender sus productos 9 horas diarias.
Ella esta muy agradecida con ODEF por la oportunidad en financiamiento que le han dado, este es su segundo préstamo por 15,000 lempiras el cual lo invertirá en comprar cosméticos para la venta. Para incrementar su inventario y por consiguiente generar mas ingresos.
Su meta es poder obtener un local estable donde pueda vender su mercadería y dar un mejor servicio a los clientes.
texts.en:
María Elena, 48, is a single mother of four children who are 18, 15, 12 and 8 years old; only one of them attends school.  She lives with her children in the village of El Edén in Peña Blanca, Cortes.

María Elena has been selling vanities (body cream, lotion, shampoo and assorted cosmetics) for 11 years.  She established this business needing to earn her own income to support her children; being a single mother she's worked hard.  She sells her merchandise in an ambulatory fashion in neighboring communities.  She states that she's had good profits that have helped her continue reinvesting in her products.  She spends nine hours daily selling her products.

She is very grateful to ODEF for the financial opportunity they've givben her.  This is her second loan.  She will use the 15,000 Lempiras to buy cosmetics to resell, to increase inventory and to generate more income.  Her goal is to be able to obtain a stable locale where she can sell her merchandise and provide better customer service.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to resell.

location.town: Aldea el Edén, Sta.Cruz de Yojoa.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama is requestiing a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to establish a motorcycle transport business by purchasing a motorcycle. The previous loan had a big impact on her business as she was able to provide for her family and her children who are attending the best school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Barot

texts.ru: Более 6 лет Барот занимается купле- продажей скота. Он очень трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он ответственный муж и заботливый отец пятерых детей. Барот покупает скот и откармливает их дома в течении 2-3 недель, а затем продает за выгодную цену. Барот хотел бы получить займ в размере 2000 Сомони для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Barot has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over six years.  He is a very hardworking and kind person.  He is a responsible husband and caring father of five children.  Barot buys livestock, fattens it up at home for 2-3 weeks and then sells it at an advantageous price.  Barot wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 2000 Somoni to buy livestock in order to expand his business.  He relies on your support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Arzikul

texts.ru: Арзикул трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 20 лет он занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания и  мелочей. Его точка находится в центре кишлака и имеет много клиентов. Арзикул хотел бы получить займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки продуктов для увлечения ассортимента продуктов. Арзикул надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Arzikul is a hardworking and kind person.  He is married and raising two children.  He has been involved in buying and selling food products and trinkets.  His retail outlet is located in the village center and attracts many customers.  Arzikul wants to obtain a loan in the amount in 3000 Somoni to buy food products in order to expand his product selection.  Arzikul relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is 63 years old and a mother of two children. She does quarrying to earn a living. She has been in the business for four years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to rent a productive plot of land for quarrying.

loans.use: To rent a productive site for quarrying

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a rice grower living at Sampaguita with his spouse and two children. He has been able to sustain his family's needs for daily meals and is very proud of it. He would like to keep earning funds and continuously finance the education of his children. In this matter, he is asking a loan of P25,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming so that he will acquire more crop yield at harvest-time. 

He hopes to keep improving his sales from the business. 

Ronald will be very happy and proud to see all his children to be professionals in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Running a sari-sari (variety) store occupies the daily schedule of Rufina. She is 51 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She usually generates an income of about P3,000 monthly. She utilizes it for the business, meals and in paying monthly electric bills. 

She is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy canned goods and bottled beverages to sell in her store. She is hoping to meet her customers' demand for affordable prices of merchandise she offers. She also would like to save funds to use in times of emergency.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and bottled beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a hard-working farmer living at Solana with his family. He raises crop in order to sell them upon harvest. He has been in this business for over five years now. He inherited a hectare plot of land from his parents which he is cultivating and planting rice in it. Magda, Gregorio's spouse, is a house keeper and is nursing their two children. 

Gregorio joined ASKI and is asking for a loan of P10,000 to improve his farming business. He will buy five bags of urea (fertilizer) and insecticides to be applied to enhance the growth of his crops.

Someday, he hopes to achieve a plentiful harvest to earn money for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy five bags of urea (fertilizer) and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
Elvis is 41 years old, married, and has one child attending school. He has been in the farming business for 20 years now. His net income from every harvest season is used for his family's expenses and part of it is a revolving capital for the business. He also pays for additional laborers who help them plant and harvest rice in a hectare of ricefield.

Elvis is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to pay for labor costs in farming and fertilizers for crop maintenance.

Through his farming business, Elvis hopes to make his family live comfortably.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in farming and fertilizers for crop maintenance

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Growing rice to sell is the primary source of income that Benito and his family rely for their livelihood. Benito started this business 20 years ago. He is very proud that income through his business, he has provided a good education for his children.

Benito still wants to improve his crop production so he is asking for additional capital to use in farming. He needs P19,000 to buy herbicides and insecticides.

Someday, Benito would like to achieve abundant crops every harvest season that will lead him to improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is an entrepreneur living at Baliuag with his wife, Jocelyn, and three children. To support the family, Jimmy has a furniture-making business to generate income. He has poured out his skills making cabinets, chairs and tables to sell as his business. He has been doing this for three years.

Now, he would like to improve his output so he is asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy wood, a saw and a hammer to use in furniture-making. Someday, he hopes to make better sales from the business, thus improving the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy wood, a saw and a  hammer to use in furniture making

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 51, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and mother to her child. She, together with her child, manage their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php400 in sales every day.     

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Evelyn hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es: Mario Ernesto vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos  en casa propia. Él se dedica a la venta de boletos de lotería por las principales calle de la localidad en la que vive, es muy buen vendedor y últimamente se ha hecho de mucha más clientela pues las personas saben que Mario es una persona confiable y vende a buenos precios, además el servicio es inigualable siempre recibe a la clientela con una enorme sonrisa en el rostro; Mario es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado, se levanta desde muy temprano a empezar su labor pues sabe que solo triunfa el que persevera, su más grande secreto es la constancia y la dedicación de esta manera esta seguro que  logrará el éxito, es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar boletos de loteria por mayor. Mario Ernesto tiene confianza que la suerte estará con él y su familia gracias al prestamo solicitado
texts.en:
Mario Ernesto lives with his life’s companion and their children in his own house.  He sells lottery tickets on the main streets in the area where he lives.  He is a very good salesman, and he has made a lot more customers lately.  People know that Mario is a trustworthy person, and he sells at good prices.  Also, his service is unparalleled.  

He always greets the customers with an enormous smile on his face.  Mario is a very hard-working and honest man.  He gets up very early to start his work.  He knows only those who persevere triumph.  His biggest secret is his perseverance and his devotion.  He is sure that this way he will achieve success.

That is why he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL.  The loan will allow him to buy lottery tickets wholesale.  Mario Ernesto is confident that luck will be with him and his family thanks to the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets wholesale.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de sesenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su nieto; ella posee una tienda en el lugar de su residencia donde vende productos de primera necesidad frijoles, huevos, bebida, jabones entre otros, últimamente ha aumentado su clientela, pues la gente está satisfecha de que sea la tienda más surtida de la zona además los productos  son  de primera calidad y vende a precios accesibles; Santos es una mujer dedicada, con muchas ganas de salir adelante y hacer crecer su negocio, piensa que lo más importante para llegar al éxito, es la motivación y la perseverancia, ella está motivada y por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, pan, jabones etc. Santos tiene fe que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is 64, and lives with her grandson. She has a store in her home where she sells basic household necessities such as beans, eggs, drinks, soaps, and other items. 

Lately she has increased her clientele, as people are satisfied that the store is the best-stocked in the area. In addition, the products are top-quality, and she sells them at affordable prices. Santos is a dedicated woman, with a great desire to succeed and make her business grow. She believes that the most important thing for achieving success is motivation and perseverance. 

She is motivated, and that is why she decided to apply to Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy staple grains, instant products, candy, bread, soaps, etc. Santos has faith that in this way she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy staple grains, instant products, candy, bread, and soaps.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Hilda Casilda

texts.es: Hilda es una mujer de 36 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su producto por catalogo su historia empezó desde que le ha gustado tener mi propio ingreso por eso me decidí a poner mi propio negocio, su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es comprarme una vitrina grande y poner un local. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su producto por catalogo y asi comprar cosmeticos, perfumes, ropa ect.
texts.en: Hilda is a 36 year-old woman who aspires to prosper in the coming years.  She sells products through a catalog.  She started her business because she liked the idea of having her own income.  She works on her own, and she faces difficulties such as crime.  She is married and has children.  Her main dream is to buy herself a big glass display case and set up a shop.  She wants to use this loan to buy products from a catalog, including cosmetics, perfumes, clothing, etc.

loans.use: to buy products from a catalog, including cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Letty Orfilia

texts.es: Letty es una mujer de 45 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su producto por catalogo su historia empezó desde muy joven me gusto trabajar ser independiente y decidí que ya era hora de instalar mi negocio, su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no está casada, no tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es crear un local pequeño y incrementar mi negocio. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su producto por catalogo y asi comprar ropa, bisuteria, cosmeticos.
texts.en: Letty is a 45 year-old woman who has many aspirations to succeed in the years to come.  She sells products from a catalog.  She began working when she was very young.  She likes working independently, and decided that it was time to have her own business.  She works on her own, and crime can be a problem.  She is not married and has no children.  Her most important dream is to establish a small shop and grow her business.  Consequently, she wants this loan to buy more products through a catalog, including clothing, accessories and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy products through a catalog including clothing, accessories and cosmetics

loans.name: Akuol

texts.en:
Akuol lives in Bor. She sells food in a stall and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children. One is in school. 

Akuol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 SDG in order to purchase onions and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase onions and beans for sale.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 26-year-old married woman. She has three children between the ages of 9 months and 5 years. One is enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Albert and he works as a businessman. Emily operates a vegetable stall business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Emily’s other source of income includes selling of charcoal. 

Emily describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is the high cost of transportation. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Emily will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase sacks of vegetables, onions, tomatoes and potatoes. Emily aspires to open a new kiosk in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, onions, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is still farming. Thanks to farming he is able to provide for his big family. His sister and grandmother now also live with him. 

Artak’s first loan allowed him to start pig breeding and thus to increase his family income. He is now requesting another loan for  800,000 AMD, which he will use to buy four piglets, two calves, and fodder.  Artak will use his future income to sow oats on his own plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, calves, and fodder.

loans.name: Twisungane/ Kbz Group

texts.fr:
Emirienne fait partie du groupe Twisungane/Kbz. Il a 54 ans, il est marie avec 2 enfants de 21 à 25 ans, dont 2 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Emirienne est agriculteur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Emirienne voudrait être fournisseur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser, soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Emirienne is a member of the group Twisungane/Kbz. She is 54 years old and married with two children aged 21 and 25 who have both received schooling. Her own education level is 6 years of primary school. 

Emirienne is a farmer. This is her first loan cycle with ACB, and she will use the funds to buy chemical fertilizers and pay the labor costs.

Her business growth strategy is to use selected chemical fertilizers. In the coming years, she would like to become a rice supplier in her area. She will use the profits earned to provide for her children’s education and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of clothing to sell.

She has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Maricel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jumakan

texts.ru: Жумакан 54 года. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Жумакан занимается животноводством, начатым в 1991 году. Стартовав с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS), Жумакан смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью около 14,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жумакан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы Жумакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Jumakan is 54 years old.  She has been involved in animal husbandry since 1991 to provide a source of income for her family.  Having started the business with 20,000 som (KGS), Jumakan was able to grow her business to yield about 14,000 som (KGS) from sales of milk and milk products.  In order to develop her business further, she requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  Jumakan plans to invest the earnings into a further increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemi tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres, que está ubicada en un caserío cerca del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito y solo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía electrica. La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la crianza de aves de corral, pavos y gallinas los cuales engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realizan desde hace más de 5 años en la parte posterior de la casa de sus padres. También cuenta con un pequeño terreno agrícola que su madre le ha dado como herencia. Allí, Noemi ha sembrado maracuyá la cual la cosecha semanalmente. Desea comprar más alimentos para el engorde de los pavos y gallinas para que logren un tamaño y peso ideal. Con esta inversión, Noemi podrá vender sus animales a un mejor precio y seguir creciendo en su negocio. Para lograr sus metas, Noemi ha creído conveniente solicitar su primer préstamo en el monto de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Noemi is 29, single, and does not have children. She lives in her parents' home, located in a settlement near Tambogrande district, a farming area in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region. 

She lives in the rural part of this district, and only has basic electricity service. The borrower raises poultry, such as turkeys and chickens, which she fattens to then sell in the local market. She has been doing this for more than five years in the area behind her parents' house. 

She also has a small piece of farmland that her mother has given her as an inheritance. There, Noemi has planted maracuyá (passion fruit), which she harvests weekly. She wishes to buy more feed for fattening her turkeys and chickens so that they attain an ideal size and weight.  

With this investment, Noemi will be able to sell her birds at a better price and continue growing in her business. To achieve her goals, Noemi has thought it appropriate to apply for her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1,000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Ajoh

texts.en:
Ajoh lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school. 

Ajoh heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is taking another Kiva loan of KES 40,000. With the loan, she wants to pay school fees for her child who attends school. 

With the previous loan, she was able to improve her business and her monthly profits increased by 50 percent. Thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for providing an opportunity to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a hog raiser and been doing this for over a year. This serves as her source of income. Her spouse is a laborer in a farm and generates unstable income. Jenifer has two children. She is 20 years old and needs to earn funds for her family. She did not finish her education so she just got involved in raising hogs to sell. 

Now, she is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy hog feed and medicines for sustainability. Someday, she hopes to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds and medicines for sustainability

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is 39 years old. A business lady, she is married to Benjamin, a businessman. They are blessed with four children. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the past 15 years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Lillian will use the loan to buy more stock of  used clothes for sale. 


With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique.

loans.use: to add  more  stock of  used  clothes for sale.

loans.name: Urmat Group

texts.ru:
Анаркан – лидер группы «Урмат», ей 62 года, имеет 4-х взрослых детей.  Анаркан занимается полеводством, начав этот бизнес после распада Советского Союза с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS).  Анаркан  обрабатывает 4,50 га земли с фасолью и картофелем, продавая затем урожай в сезон.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаркан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп удобрений.  Доходы от кредита Анаркан планирует вложить в оборудование своего дома паровым отоплением. 

Аскеру 30 лет, женат, имеет одного сына. В целях развития своего бизнеса, Аскер обратился в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп удобрений.  Доходы от кредита Аскер планирует вложить в постройку сарая. 
 
Урмату 28 лет, женат, имеет трех детей. В целях развития своего бизнеса, Урмат обратился в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп удобрений.
texts.en:
Anarkan is the leader of the "Urmat" group.  She is 62 years old and has four adult children.  Anarkan is involved in farming, having started this business with 20,000 som (KGS) after the breakup of the Soviet Union.  She works on 4.50 hectares of land, growing beans and potatoes and then selling the harvest during the season.  In order to continue developing her business, Anarkan requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy fertilizers.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into provisioning her house with steam heating.

Asker is 30 years old, married and has one son.  In order to develop his business, he requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy fertilizers.  Asker plans to invest the earnings from the loan into building a barn.

Urmat is 28 years old, married and has three children.  In order to develop his business, he requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Sofiya

texts.ru: София трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она вдова и заботливая мать двоих детей. Более 5 лет она занимается купле- продажей скота, в бизнесе ей помогает сын. София содержит и откармливает скот дома, имеет коровник для них. Этим бизнесом она содержит свою семью. София хотела бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Sofiya is a hardworking and conscientious woman.  She is a widow and a caring mother of two children.  She has been involved in buying and selling livestock with the help of her son for over five years.  Sofiya keeps and fattens up livestock at home, where she has a cowshed for it.  This business provides for her family.  Sofiya wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 5000 Somoni to buy livestock in order to expand her business.  She relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to expand her business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 30 years old and married with one child. He sells vehicle spare parts to earn a living. He has been in the business for seven years and has employed three people. To earn extra income  he does poultry farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand his business further in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare  parts to  sell

loans.name: Abuot

texts.en:
Abuot lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for two years. She is 40 years old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Abuot heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 37-year-old married woman. She has two children and both are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Omar and he works as a taxi driver. 

Angelina operates a retail shop business and sells her goods from home. She has worked in this business for five years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Angelina's other source of income includes her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Angelina will use the KES 30,000 loan to pay school fees for her child. Angelina aspires to open a new kiosk at the market in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Akuol

texts.en:
Akuol lives in Bor. She has a food stall and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are still in school. 

Akuol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. 

She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou est un homme âgé de 28 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il a 1 enfant. 
Kokou travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il vend des articles de quincaillerie pour tous clients. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Kokou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de quincaillerie. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kokou voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kokou is a 28-year-old man who is married to a reseller. The couple have one child. 

Kokou started selling hardware items in 2010. He works alone, and buys his stock in Lomé. For the time being, his main hurdle is a shortage of merchandise. 

Kokou is seeking his first loan from WAGES to replenish his stock of hardware items. He wants to reinvest in his activity.
 
In the coming years, Kokou would like to expand the size of his business. He plans to use the profits earned to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy hardware merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Marcos Augusto

texts.es:
Marcos es un joven de 27 años, vive en el distrito de Santiago, Ica Perú; el distrito de Santiago se caracteriza por su agricultura en especial de la siembre de esparrago y la cosecha de uva, asimismo en él se ubican varias agropexportadoras que brinda muchos puestos de trabajo en la zona, como buen peruano a marcos le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país y uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo arroz Verde, en su tiempo libre disfruta de jugar futbol con sus vecinos.

Marcos se dedica a su trabajo como chofer de taxi, el se dedica a su negocio alrededor d e10 horas al día, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y es honrado en su trabajo.
Marcos está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su auto, con esta mejora su vehículo podrá estar en buenas condiciones para transportar a sus clientes y brindarles más seguridad, así seguirá trabajando y luchando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Mejorar su calidad de vida y ser Feliz”.
texts.en:
Marcos is a young man of 27, and lives in Santiago district, in the Ica region of Peru. Santiago district is noted for its farming, especially for growing asparagus and grapes. As well, several agro-export companies are located there, that provide many jobs in the area. 

Like a good Peruvian, Carlos really likes the traditional foods of our country, and one of his favorite dishes is the very delicious arroz verde (rice prepared with cilantro and vegetables). In his spare time he enjoys playing soccer with his neighbors. Marcos is a taxi driver, and works in his business for around ten hours a day. He thinks his work is going well because he is very friendly with the customers and he is honest in his work. 

Marcos is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help that they have provided him he will be able to do maintainance on his car. With this work, his vehicle will be in good condition for transporting his customers, and offer them greater safety. This way he will continue working and striving to fulfill his great dream: "To improve his quality of life and be happy."

loans.use: To maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 42 years old and single. Doreen works very hard to provide for herself.

Doreen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell.

Doreen has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, shampoo and school supplies. 

In the future Doreen would like to save enough money to buy a computer for her other business.

loans.use: to purchase more  products to sell.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander vive en la ciudad de Camana, Famoso por sus exquisitos camarones, sus machas y el encanto de sus pobladores que siempre ofrecen sus tradicionales bollos, alfajores y oquendos; Es el primer productor en el mundo de arroz por hectárea, por grandes cantidades, entre tanta producción se encuentra el arroz Tacuarí, que viene a ser el mejor y más rico arroz. -Además de producir el mejor arroz, también tiene el más rico frejol; sus playas son las más extensas y más limpias del Sur del país. Los científicos dicen que son las playas más hermosas del sur y que tendría un gran futuro a nivel nacional, como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de sus paltos favoritos son los riquísimo frejoles, el solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Mecánica automotriz.

Alexander trabaja como chofer de taxi, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 11 horas diarias, puede atender hasta 60 clientes de manera diaria, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y respetuoso con los clientes.

Alexander está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá realizar la conversión de su vehículo de gasolina a gas licuado (GLP), con esta mejora el tendrá mayores ingresos ya que no gastara mucho en combustible, así podrá seguir luchando cada día por cumplir su gran sueño:" Estudiar Mecánica Automotriz”
texts.en:
Alexander lives in the city of Camaná, famous for its exquisite shrimp, its clams, and its charming people who always serve their traditional rolls, "alfajores" [sandwich cookies with dulce de leche filling], and "oquendos" [pastries with dulce de leche filling and fondant icing].  It is the world's largest producer of rice per hectare, including Tacuarí rice, one of the best and tastiest types of rice there is.  In addition to producing the best rice, the area produces the most delicious beans. The beaches there are the most extensive and the cleanest in the southern part of the country.  The scientists say that they are the most beautiful beaches in the south and that they have a good future nationally.

As a good Peruvian he likes the traditional cuisine of our country very much.  One of his favorite dishes is our delicious beans.  He only studied to the fifth level of secondary school, but he would have enjoyed studying auto mechanics.

Alexander works as a taxi driver.  He works about 11 hours a day and is able to serve up to 60 customers on a daily basis.  He believes it is going well for him in his business because he is friendly and respectful with the customers.

Alexander is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he will be able to convert his vehicle from gas to liquefied petroleum gas (LPG).  With this improvement he will have better income because he will no longer spend very much on combustible.  In this way he will be able to continue fighting every day to achieve his big dream: "To study auto mechanics."

loans.use: to convert his vehicle from gas to liquefied petroleum gas (LPG).

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.en: Jhonny, a 32-year-old married father of three children, two of whom are attending elementary school, became a farmer after high school and would like to increase his crop production to provide economic stability for his family. Now requesting a loan of P30,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and pesticides for use on his farm, he aspires to give the best education possible to his children as his legacy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Yonny Segundo

texts.es: Segundo es un hombre de 37 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su fabricación de ladrillos su historia empezó desde los 8 años trabajando con su papa y escogió la actividad ya que es la única que conocía y además le da buenos ingresos, su trabajo lo hace solo, tiene dificultades, es casado, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es seguir produciendo ladrillos en cantidades grandes. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su fabricación de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Segundo is 37, and is a man with many ambitions to see his brick-making business prosper in the coming years. His story begins from when he was eight years old, working with his father, and he chose this trade; it was the only one he knows, and besides, it gives him a good income.  

He works alone, and sometimes deals with work challenges. He is married and has children. His most important dream is to continue producing bricks in large quantities. That is why he wants the loan for his brick-making business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as earth, sawdust, and firewood.

loans.name: Alek

texts.en: Alek s 30-year-old married mother of two children, one of whom is in school, lives in Bor where she has operated a food stall for three years. Alek heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer  and is now requesting a loan for 500 SDG in order to purchase onion and okra. She will use the extra income arising from this loan to pay her child's school fee.

loans.use: to purchase onion and okra for resale.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en: This time, Esperanza is borrowing Php 11,000 to fund her general store. The food production business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Bor. She sells food in a stall and has been in business for two years. She is 36 years old, married, and has three children. All of them are still in school. 

Sarah heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase onions and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and beans for sale.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 28 years old and married with four children.  With one child in school already, she works very hard to provide for them.

Marjorie runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, snack foods and other groceries. 

Marjorie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has four children and all are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Bakwere. 

Eunice sells her goods in her cosmetics shop. She's worked in this business for 10 months. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. 

Eunice's other sources of income include her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Eunice owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase cosmetics to stock for her business. Eunice aspires to open a new kiosk at the market in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Pilarina

texts.en:
Pilarina is 41 years old and married with three children.

Pilarina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Pilarina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari (variety) store for eight years and also earns an income from abaca (natural fiber) weaving.

Pilarina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and a mother of three children. She sells items like mattresses, wall units and sofa sets. She has applied for a loan of KES. 20,000  which she plans to use to buy more materials like timber, sponge and small nails for making the furniture for selling.

Elizabeth aspires to be financially stable and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to build wall units and sofa sets.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman. She has two children and both are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Athman and he works as a taxi driver. 

Mwanasiti operates a motorcycle at the market. She's worked in this business for one year. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. She describes her greatest business challenge to be high cost of purchasing fuel and her highest monthly expenses are school fees and rent. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Mwanasiti will use the Kes 20,000 loan to pay school fees for her child. Mwanasiti aspires to to purchase another motorcycle in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 39-years-old, married and has a 2 children who currently going to school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ester has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Ester requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

Ester has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Ester would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
This is Mariam, 26, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Mariam operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and prepare food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Mariam dreams to grow her business in the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Djatougbé

texts.fr:
Datougbé est une femme âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée à un employé au port. Elle a 3 enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 9 ans.
Datougbé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale et des produits génériques pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Datougbé a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Datougbé voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer les besoins vitaux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Datougbé is a 45 year old woman. She is married and employed by the harbour. She has three children between the ages of 15 and 9 who attend school. 
Since 2005, Datougbé has been in the retail business since 2005, selling basic food products as well as other retail items. She works alone, purchasing her products in Lomé and re-selling them at the market. Her current challenge is not having enough stock to satisfy customers. She is asking for her third loan from WAGES in order to purchase more products to sell. She would like to continue investing in her business. In the coming years, Datougbéhopes to increase the numbers of sales, and use the profits to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: purchase basic food products and other goods

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 57-years-old, is married and has 2 children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sodas, sugar, rice, cooking oil and loaves of bread for sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas, sugar, rice, cooking oil and loaves of bread for sell.

loans.name: Merylou

texts.en: This time, for her 6th cycle loan, Merylou is borrowing Php 18,000 to fund her general store business. She previously funded her fruits and vegetables business. Merylou is saving enough money to build a junk shop to increase the income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy items to sell for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ejoheza / Mrm Group

texts.fr:
Donatile fait partie du groupe Ejoheza/Mrm. Elle a 43 ans, elle est mariée avec 3 enfants de 18 à 23 ans, dont 1 scolarise. Son niveau d’éducation est de 7 ans de primaire.

Donatile est agricultrice. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de chercher les marchés pour ses tomates. Dans les prochaines années, Donatile voudrait être professionnel dans l’agriculture. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de scolariser, soigner ses enfants et construire une maison.
texts.en: Donatile is a member of the Ejoheza/Mrm group. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 18 to 23, one of whom attended school. Her own education level is 7 years of primary school. She works in agriculture. This is her first loan request from ACB, which she will use to purchase fertilizer. Her growth strategy for her business is to identify markets where she can sell her tomatoes. In the next few years, Donatile would like to gain more experience in the agriculture sector. She plans to use profits from her sales to send her children to school, keep them healthy, and build a home for her family.

loans.use: purchase chemical fertilizer

loans.name: Yessica Esmeralda

texts.es: Yessica Esmeralda habita junto con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando.  Ella se  dedica   a la venta de ropa para todos los gustos y preferencias. Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado central de la zona donde habita, lugar que es muy transitado en especial el puesto de Yessica ya que cuando de  ropa se trata ella tiene variedad a los precios más accesibles.  Gracias a su carisma y dedicación en su trabajo ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas que cada día la prefieren más. Yessica es una mujer increíble la cual trabaja duramente para colaborar con los gastos del hogar ya que los ingresos de su compañero de vida no son suficientes para cubrir las diferentes necesidades económicas que cada día son mayores. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que trabaja duramente para poder dar el pan de cada día y poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, camisetas, blusas, pantalones, y de mas productos que ayuden a atraer a más clientes de tal forma que sus ventas se vean en aumento al igual que sus ingresos. Espera que de esta forma pueda alcanzar su sueño de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yessica Esmeralda lives with her life partner and their two children, who are studying.  She works selling clothing for all tastes and preferences.  Her business is located in the main market of the area where she lives, a place that is very busy, especially Yessica's stall because, when it comes to clothing, she has variety at the most accessible prices.  Thanks to her charisma and dedication to her job she has managed to earn the trust of many people who prefer her more every day.

Yessica is an incredible woman who works hard to help with the household expenses because her life partner's income is not sufficient to cover the different financial needs, which are greater every day.  For her the most important thing is her family, for whom she works hard to be able to provide their daily bread and improve their living conditions. 

She has made the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her business by buying a variety of articles of clothing, such as skirts, t-shirts, blouses, and pants, and other products that help her attract more customers in such a way that her sales as well as her earnings increase.  She hopes that in this way she can realize her dream of improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy skirts, t-shirts, blouses, pants, etc.

loans.name: Battur

texts.en:
Borrower Battur is a 30-year-old married guy, who has three children and lives with his family in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. He works as a driver in local non-governmental organization as well as operating a small workshop with help from his wife.

The smocks that he holds his hand are one of their very popular brands and they usually sew the clothes by order.  As the business becomes more successful,  Battur needs one more sewing machine and to increase his working capital in order to buy materials. He is requesting a 2.000.000 Mongolian Tugriks /MNT/ to purchase a sewing machine and variety of materials.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and increase his working capital.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou est un homme âgé de 31 ans. Il est marié å un/e revendeuse. Il a 02enfants. L’ainé a 03ans et le dernier 01an.
Kokou travaille comme coordonnier depuis 2009. Il exerce son activité dans un atelier et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Kokou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des matériaux pour la fabrication des chaussures. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kokou voudrait prospérer son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Kokou is a 31 year old man. He is married to a re-seller, with whom he has 2 children aged 3 and 1. Kokou has been working as a shoemaker/cobbler since 2009, works out of a workshop and stocks up in Lomé. Kokou is asking for his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase more products in order to make more shoes, and invest in his business. In the coming years, Kokou would like to continue growing his business. He plans to use the profits to take care of his family.

loans.use: purchase materials to make shoes

loans.name: Wella

texts.fr:
Wella est un homme âgé  de 57ans. Il est marié å un/e ménagére. Il a 05 enfants, dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 30 ans et le dernier a 18 ans.  
Wella travaille comme revendeur  de boissons depuis 2005. Il vend dans un bar et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Wella a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des boissons. Il veut épargner les profits.
Dans les prochaines années, Wella voudrait agrandir l’activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit d’assurer les vitaux de sa famille.
texts.en: Wella is a 57 year old man, who is married to a housekeeper. He has 5 children between the ages of 18 and 30, 1 of whom attends school. Walla has been working as a re-seller of drinks since 2005. He sells in a bar and stocks up in Lomé. Walla is asking for his first credit from WAGES in order to purchase more drinks and make more profits from their sales. In the coming years, Walla would like to increase his business, and use the profits to take care of his family's needs.

loans.use: purchase drinks

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a hardworking mother who operates a store and raises hogs for future sale; she established the latter enterprise to increase her income. Married to a farmer, she is the mother of two children, the eldest presently working in a restaurant, while the youngest is in high school.

Pacita is now requesting a loan of P50,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and medicines for her 11 piglets. With proper growth and nutrition, she can sell them for a good price, thereby increasing her income.

Pacita aims to have a business well-diversified and establish a stable income for the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and medicines for piglets' sustainability.

loans.name: Komanta

texts.fr:
Komanta est une femme âgé(e) de 49 ans. Elle est mariée å un  imprimeur. Elle 02 enfants âgés respectivement de 24 et 21ans.
Komanta travaille comme revendeuse de charbons de bois et bois de chauffe  depuis 2003. Elle vend seule à la maison et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Komanta a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des charbons de bois et des bois de chauffe. Elle veut épargner les profits.
Dans les prochaines années, Komanta voudrait agrandir l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en: Komanta is a 49 year old woman who is married to a printer. She has two children aged 24 and 21. She has been re-selling wood coal and firewood since 2003. She sells from her home, but stocks up in Lomé. Komanta is asking for her second loan from WAGES in order to purchase more products, in order to sell more. In the coming years, Komana would like to increase her business activity. She says that she will use the profits to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: purchase bags of wood coal and firewood

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталья уже пользовалась кредитами для развития бизнеса раньше и считает их очень выгодными. На это раз Наталья просит предоставиь ей кредит в сумме 12,000 гривен, чтобы закупить новую весеннюю коллекцию духов и туалетной воды. По словам Натальи, этот товар всегда пользуется спросом при условии, что есть новые пополнеия. А весна - особенно подходящий сезон для развития данного вида бизнеса.

Наталья использовала предыдущий кредит для пополнения ассортимента парфюмерии. Благодаря этому увеличился доход. Наталья смогла улучшить свои жилищные условия - приобрести бытовую технику.
texts.en: Nataliya has already used loans to develop her business in the past and considers them to be advantageous.  This time, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 12,000 hryvnia to buy a new spring collection of perfumes and eau de toilette.  According to Nataliya's words, this merchandise is always in demand, but only when there is new selection additions.  And spring is an especially suitable season for developing this type of business.  Nataliya used her previous loan to refill her perfume inventory.  Thanks to that, her income increased.  Nataliya was able to improve her living conditions by buying household appliances.

loans.use: to purchase new perfumes to sell in her store

loans.name: Bartchissou

texts.fr:
Bartchissou est une femme âgé(e) de 46 ans. Elle est mariée å un officier de police. Elle a 02 enfants, dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 23 ans et le dernier a 17 ans.  
Bartchissou travaille comme revendeuse de basins, pagnes, bijoux et produits de mercerie depuis 2003. Elle sert tous ses clients de façon ambulante et achète à Lomé.
Bartchissou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bazins, des pagnes, des bijoux et des produits de mercerie. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité
Dans les prochaines années, Bartchissou voudrait faire prospérer son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Bartchissou is a 46-year-old woman.  She is married to a police officer and has two children, one of whom is in school.  The older child is 23 years old and the younger child is 17.

Bertchissou has worked as a reseller of damask and patterned fabrics, jewelry, and sewing products since 2003.  She serves all her customers on foot and buys her products in Lomé.  Bertchissou has requested her first loan through WAGES in order to buy damask fabric, patterned fabric, jewelry, and sewing products.  She would like to reinvest in her business.  In the next few years, Bertchissou would like to make her business prosper.  She says that with the profits she envisions increasing the well-being and happiness of her family.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and damask and patterned fabric.

loans.name: Jose Cesar

texts.es: César es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad. Él vive junto a su familia en la zona de Túcume es una ciudad conocida por la agricultura y ganadería, es una comunidad rural pequeña perteneciente al departamento de Lambayeque. César desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de animales, cuenta con un ganado vacuno y porcino así como con aves de corral (patos, pavos y gallinas). La experiencia de César lo ha llevado a tener una buena cantidad de clientes, quienes compran los animales de César constantemente. Debido a la demanda que generan los animales que César vende, este necesita ampliar su negocio. César solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2500 nuevos soles que desea invertir en la compra de animales para criarlos y venderlos. Para criarlos necesita que estos tengan una buena alimentación y es por eso que parte del crédito también iría destinada a la compra de alimento balanceado para sus nuevos animales. César contó con un préstamo anterior, en nuestra entidad, que cancelo puntual y responsablemente.
texts.en:
César is a 30-year-old father.  He lives with his family in the Túcume area, a city known for agriculture and livestock.  It is a small rural community in the department of Lambayeque.

César has worked selling animals for five years.  He has cattle and pigs as well as poultry (ducks, turkeys, and chickens).  César's experience has helped him to have a good number of customers who constantly buy his animals.  Due to the demand generated from the animals César sells, he needs to expand his business.

César is requesting a loan of 2500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in buying animals to raise and sell.  To raise them he needs them to have good nutrition, so part of the loan will go toward buying balanced feed for his new animals.

César had a previous loan with us that he repaid quickly and responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Victor Danilo

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por una de sus principales actividades que es la agricultura, además de su clima cálido en cualquier época del año; como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida, en su tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos, para poder distraerse cuando esta de mal humor.

Victor trabaja como chofer de taxi por la calles de su ciudad, le dedica alrededor de 10 horas al día  y puede atender hasta 45 clientes, el trabaja mayormente en la madrugada ya que a esa hora el servicio cuesta un poco mas y puede tener más ingresos.

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podrá comprar llantas nuevas y realizar mantenimiento a su vehículo, así podrá tener un vehículo en mejor estado para trabajar y seguirá luchando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Victor is a hard working man. He lives in the city of Ica, a city known for one of its main business activities; farming. As well as it warm climate during all the year. Like a good Peruvian he likes food a lot. In his free time he enjoys playing football with his friends and neighbours in order to forget his worried when he is in a bad mood.

Victor works as a taxi driver on the streets of his city. He spends around ten hours a day working and can cater to up to 45 customers. He works mainly early in the morning which is when the service costs a little more and he can earn more.

Victor is very grateful for the Kiva loans as thanks to the support they have given him he will be able to buy new tyres and carry out maintenance on his vehicle. This way he will have a vehicle in better conditions for working and he will continue fighting in order to fulfil his biggest dream: "to have his own house".

loans.use: to buy tyres and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is single and 24 years old. She lives in the Philippines.
Naomi is a farmer. She grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 1 year. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase food and vitamins for the pigs.
Naomi has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Naomi hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food and vitamins for the pigs

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 36 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa de 36 años de edad y sus 4 hijos.  Francisco es un hombre admirable ya que trabaja duramente para sacar adelante a su querida familia. Desde hace varios años  se dedica a trabajar en su pequeño taller el cual está ubicado en su hogar de habitación. Dicho negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y es lo que le ha permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Su sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Todo lo anterior ha influido en la decisión de  Francisco de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el fin de invertir en su negocio en la compra de las herramientas y materia prima necesaria (tenazas, máquina para fundir hierro, herramienta para cortar hierro, hierro) y de mas materiales que permitan dar un mejor servicio a los clientes ya que de esta forma espera mejorar su nivel de ingresos y lograr su objetivo de dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Francisco, age 36, lives in his own home with his family: his wife, age 36, and their four children. Francisco is an admirable man; he works hard to get his beloved family ahead. He has worked in his small workshop, located in his home, for several years. This business is his main source of income, and it has allowed him to provide his family's daily bread. His dream is to be able to improve his family's living conditions. All of this has influenced Francisco's decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL, with the goal of investing in his business through buying the necessary tools and basic supplies (pliers, a machine for smelting iron, tools for cutting iron, iron) and other materials that will allow him to provide a better service. He hopes that this will improve his income and allow him to reach his goal of giving his family a better quality of life.
