loans.use: to buy: pliers, a machine to smelt iron, tools for cutting iron, iron, etc.

loans.name: Jekafo Group

texts.fr:
JEKAFO est un regroupement de 7 femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 33  ans, 4 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à Massablacoura, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de produits alimentaires et des habits de friperies à l’image de FATOUMATA , assise devant le groupe.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, deux colis de friperie. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au  marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et  d’hommes en détail, au comptant et à crédit payable journalièrement. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000.FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
JEFAKO is a group of seven married women who are, on average, 33 years old and have four children.  They live in traditional families in Massablacoura, one of the districts of the city of Bougouni (the third administrative region of Mali).
They have taken out their second joint loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the demand of their customers.  This group of women is in the business of selling grocery products and second hand clothing, as does Fatoumata, seated in front of the group. 
She plans to buy two bundles of clothing with her loan. She gets her supplies at the main market in Bamako (the capital of Mali) from wholesalers.  She makes her sales at the market in Bougouni and from home to a clientele of women and men, at retail, for cash and on credit, payable daily or weekly.
She foresees making an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA.  A part of this will be used to assist her husband with daily expenses and the other part will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline, a 34-year-old mother of two children aged 5 and 13, both students, is married to Kenneth. Jackline has been operating a kiosk (retail) shop for four years, her primary customers passersby and neighbours. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation, and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water.

Jackline joined Yehu to access capital, and is now requesting this Kes 25,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She aspires to establish a vegetable stall business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years.

Juditha has requested a loan of PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy more goods such as snack-foods and other groceries.

Juditha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods such as snack-foods, and other groceries

loans.name: Kankele Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KANKELE est constitué de 4 femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 40  ans, 5 enfants et vivant  dans des familles nucléaires à Dougounina, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales avec  YAMA , de la  vente de friperie et des bois de chauffe.
YAMA, assise,  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  700 kg de de maïs. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de BOUGOUNI auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au  marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000.FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The KANKELE group is made up of four married women who are, on average, 40 years old and have five children.  They live in nuclear families in Dougounina, one of the districts of the city of Bougouni (in the third administrative region of Mali).
They have taken out their sixth joint loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the demand of their customers.  With Yawa, this group of women is in the business of selling cereal, second hand clothing, and firewood.  
Yama, seated, plans to buy 700 kg of corn with her loan. She gets her supplies at the main market in Bougouni from wholesalers.  She makes her sales at the market in Bougouni and from home to a clientele of women and men, at retail, for cash and on credit.
She foresees making an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA.  A part of this will be used to assist her husband with daily expenses and the other part will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Ninkpibe

texts.fr:
Ninkpibe est une femme âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un employé. Elle a 4 enfants.
Ninkpibe travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale, du charbon de bois et des tubercules d’igname pour tous clients. Elle achète les produits à Bassar et à Lomé. Elle travaille avec une personne. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir pas satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Ninkpibe a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale, du charbon de bois et des tubercules d’igname. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ninkpibe voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Ninkpibe is a 39 year old woman married to an unemployed man. She has 4 children. Ninkpibe has been working in the retail industry since 2000. She sells basic food products, wood carbon, and yams. She stocks up in Bassar and Lomé and works with one other person to re-sell them. Her current challenge is having enough stock to satisfy her customer's demands. Ninkpibe is asking for her second loan from WAGES in order to purchase more goods to sell. She would like to continue investing in her business. In the coming years, Ninkpibe would like to increase the size of her business, and use the profits to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: purchase basic food products and wood coal

loans.name: Francis Argentina

texts.es: La  Señora  Francis,  es  una   persona   emprendedora  y dedicada  a su negocio Venta  de refrescos , churros y variedad de confites,  todas las mañanas se instala en un  parque ya que muchas personas transitan por ese lugar y ya son clientes fijos,  actividad   que  realiza       desde hace mas de 4 años y gracias a su negocio ha mantenido a sus  3  hijos  que actualmente están estudiando  en  la  escuela  de su  barrio, junto con su esposo trabajan muy  fuerte para sacar adelante su familia. Esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 6,000.00  para la compra de refrescos, chicles, confites y churros.
texts.en:
Francis is an entrepreneur dedicated to her business. For the past 4 years she has been selling soft drinks, snacks, and a variety of sweets every morning in a park where many people pass by.  There are now regular customers and thanks to this business, she has been able to support her three children who are in school in her neighborhood.  She and her husband work hard to get their family ahead.
She is requesting the loan of 6,000.00 to buy soft drinks, gum, candies and snacks.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snacks, gum and candies for her business

loans.name: Irma Marisol

texts.es: Irma Marisol de 33 años de edad, habita en casa alquilada junto a sus dos hijos de 6 y 14 años de edad, los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Irma  se caracteriza por ser emprendedora, responsable pero sobre todo carismática. Con mucho esfuerzo a logrado mantener activo un pequeño establecimiento en al cual comercializa variedad de ropa y calzado. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos, puesto que es la única que trabaja para sacar adelante a su familia, ya que hace dos años que se separó de su compañero de vida. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este negocio por lo que ya tiene mucha experiencia en el mismo. Gracias a su carisma se ha ganado la confianza de muchas personas en la zona por lo que ya cuenta con varios clientes fijos. Irma trabaja muy duro para poder sacar adelante a su familia y poder mejorar su calidad de vida, esto la impulsa a esforzarse para que su negocio siga funcionando de la mejor manera posible. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en el negocio en la compra de productos como: maniquí, parrillas metálicas, variedad de ropa y calzado, y de más productos que ayuden a atraer a más clientes. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de abarcar una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar sus niveles de venta y de ingresos y por consecuencia poder lograr su sueño de dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Irma Marisol, age 33, lives in a rented home with her two children ages 6 and 14, who are in school. Irma is enterprising, responsible, and, above all, charismatic. Through great hard work, she has been able to keep her small store afloat. She sells a variety of clothing and shoes. This business is her main source of income, and she is the only one who works to support her children; several years ago she separated from her partner. She has had this business for many years, so she has a lot of experience. Thanks to her charisma, she has gained the confidence of many people in the area--so she has many loyal customers. Irma works very hard to get her family ahead and improve their quality of life. This motivates her to work hard so that her business will continue to function in the best possible manner. She has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL so that she can invest in her business in the purchase of products such as: mannequins, metal racks, and a variety of clothing and shoes, as well as other products to draw in more customers. She is doing all of this with the goal of serving a greater demand. This will allow her to improve her sales levels and income, and as a result reach her dream of giving her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy: a mannequin, metal racks, and a variety of clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 29 years old and single. 

He sells bulls and has been in the business for the past ten years. He gets a monthly income of KES 15,000. This is his fourth loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to purchase small bull and two goats to rear and then sell later.

He hopes to become a renowned livestock dealer.

loans.use: to purchase a small bull and two goats to rear and sell later

loans.name: Ajoh

texts.en: Ajoh, a 30-year-old married woman, lives in Bor where she has been operating a food stall for two years. Having heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, she is now requesting her  first loan for 500 SDG in order to purchase sugar and beans to sell. Ajoh will use the extra income arising from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans for resale.

loans.name: Ruth Yaneth

texts.es: Ruth Yaneth de 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y habita junto a sus dos hijos de 7 y 4 años. Ella se dedica  al comercio de diversos productos tales como: papas fritas, bebidas, galletas, golosinas, etc. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora ya que tiene mucha facilidad para los negocios. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener su negocio en marcha el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Ha trabajado duramente para lograr sacar adelante a su familia y poco a poco va saliendo adelante y va dando lo necesario a sus queridos hijos, los cuales son su fuente de inspiración. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: papas, bebidas, golosinas, dulces, etc. para mantener surtido el negocio de tal forma que esto permita atraer a más clientes  que generen un aumento en las ventas como en los ingresos, de manera que estos resultados ayuden a mejorar su calidad de vida como la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth Yaneth is 32, and is a single mother. She lives with her two children, ages 7 and 4.  She sells various products such as fried potatoes, drinks, cookies, candy, etc. She is known for being an enterprising woman, as she is very good at business. With a great deal of effort and dedication, she has managed to keep her business going, and it is her main source of income. 

She has worked hard to help her family get ahead in life, and little by little she is moving forward and giving her dear children what they need; they are what inspires her.

She has made the decision to apply to Integral for this loan, in order to invest in her small business through the purchase of the necessary supplies such as potatoes, drinks, candy, sweets, etc. This is to keep her business supplied, in a way that allows her to attract more customers. This will generate an increase in both sales and income, and these results will help her improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, drinks, candy and sweets.

loans.name: Edwin Ivan

texts.es:
Iván es un joven emprendedor de 24 años de edad. Es padre de dos niños y vive en una comunidad pequeña en vías de desarrollo en el distrito de La Matanza en Morropón. Iván se dedica a preparar el terreno para la siembra de productos agrícolas, este servicio lo brinda desde hace 3 años, y es un servicio muy requerido en la zona donde vive. Iván cuenta con clientes establecidos. Iván solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1508 Nuevos Soles para comprar herramientas modernas, ya que las que tiene se están deteriorando para preparación de tierras de cultivo y darle mantenimiento a las que tiene, y así poder desarrollar su trabajo de una manera óptima. Iván tiene muchos deseos de superación y desea seguir creciendo en su actividad para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este crédito le permitirá continuar el buen desarrollo de su labor.
Es cliente recurrente para nuestra institución cumpliendo responsablemente sus compromisos pactados.
texts.en:
Iván is a young 24-year-old entrepreneur. He is a father of two and lives in a small developing community in the La Mantanza district of Morropón. Iván's job is to prepare land for sowing crops. He has offered this service for three years; it is in high demand in the area and he has an established clientele. Iván is requesting a loan of 1508 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy modern tools; his tools are deteriorating from use. He will also use the loan to fix up some of his tools. This will allow him to work at his best. Iván has a great desire to get ahead and wants to keep improving his work in order to improve his family's quality of life. This loan will allow him to continue working well.
He is a returning client and has always followed through responsibly with his promises.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his farm-service business.

loans.name: Santos Eulalio

texts.es:
Santos de 46 años de edad, vive con su esposa y un hijo en su casa propia, la cual cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en la provincia de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana. La actividad que desarrolla Santos es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y a veces mango, un fruto (limón) que es consumido diariamente por los pobladores, una vez que realiza la cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Piura y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su hogar. También cría y vende ovejas y aves de corral y es otro modo de obtener más ingresos económicos. Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1600 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y abastecerse de alimentos balanceados para sus animales, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. Santos es un hombre que se preocupa por que su familia mejore y tenga algunas comodidades.
Es un cliente recurrente para nuestra institución pagando de manera puntual sus créditos.
texts.en:
Santos is 46 years old.  He lives with his wife and son in their own house, which has electricity only and is located in the Tambogrande Province in the Piura Department.  Agriculture, livestock and crafts are predominant in this area.  

Santos works in agriculture.  He has his own farmland where he grows lemon and sometimes mango.  Lemon is a fruit which is consumed daily by the local people.  Once he harvests his crops, they are sold to different markets in Piura; this is how he raises money to cover household expenses.  He also raises and sells sheep and poultry to increase his income.  

Santos has requested a loan of $600 through Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy fertilizers to improve his land as well as his produce and to buy stock feed for his animals.  His ultimate goal is to be able to offer his products at a better price to merchants and to work toward providing a higher standard of living to his family.  Santos is a man who cares about his family's condition improving and making sure that they are comfortable.

Santos is a repeat client with Edpyme Alternativa and he makes his loan payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and crop fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings, which are needed in her business.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is 27 years old and married with one child. He  runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sodas, sugar, maize flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: To buy sodas, sugar, maize flour and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto  de 53 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con sus 3 hijos de 7, 14, y 17 años de edad. Los tres se encuentran estudiando. Él se dedica al negocio de taller de costura en el cual fabrica diversidad de prendas de vestir para todos los gustos y preferencias. Tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad  por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y reconocimiento. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y es el que le ha permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Su principal deseo es que su familia tenga diferentes oportunidades de vida a las que él tuvo y esa es la razón por la que trabaja duramente para sacar adelante a su querida familia. Él es un hombre trabajador, dedicado y sobre todo responsable, todo esto ha permitido ganarse la confianza de sus vecinos  que cada día lo prefieren más. Todo lo anterior lo ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su taller de costura en la compra de la materia prima necesaria (telas, botones, elástico,  listones, hilos, etc.) para cubrir una mayor demanda de mercado y de esta manera poder mejorar   sus niveles de ventas como de ingresos que conlleven a lograr  su sueño de dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Confía en Dios todo poderoso que así será.
texts.en: Gilberto, age 53, lives in his own home with his three children ages 7, 14, and 17, who are in school. He has a sewing shop where he makes a variety of garments for all tastes and preferences. He has been doing this for five years, so he has a great deal of experience and is well-known. This business is his main source of income and has allowed him to provide his family's daily bread. His main desire is for his family to have life opportunities different from those he has had. For this reason, he works hard to get his beloved family ahead. He is hard-working, dedicated, and, above all, responsible. This has allowed him to gain the confidence of his neighbours, who like his business more every day. All of this has led him to the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in his sewing workshop through the purchase of the necessary basic material (fabric, buttons, elastic, ribbon, thread, etc). This will allow him to serve a higher demand, thus improving his sales levels. This will then allow him to reach his dream of providing his family with a better quality of life. He trusts in God almighty that this will be the case.

loans.use: to buy: fabric, buttons, elastic, ribbon, thread, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 30-year-old married woman.  She has two children between the ages of eight and ten and they are both enrolled in school.  Her husband's name is Gilbert.  Elizabeth operates a green grocery (fruits and vegetables) and sells her goods in a shop.  She has worked in this business for three years.  Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby.  Elizabeth's other source of income includes her husband's earnings.  She explains that her greatest business challenge is the competition and her highest monthly expense is food for the family.  She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Elizabeth will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, avocados, and paw-paw.  Elizabeth aspires to establish her own shop to sell her products in the future.  She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, avocados, and paw-paw.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen lives in Bor. She sells food in a stall and has been in business for three years. She is 28 years old, married, and has no children. 

Ayen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase beans and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old, comes from Olkalou, and is married with two children who are in primary school.

Mary is a farmer and has applied for her first loan to enable her to buy potato seeds, fertilizers, and pay for labour. She was introduced to KADET LTD by another client and is optimistic that her farm will do well after the loan.

She hopes to diversify into the hotel business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds, fertilizers, and pay for labor

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 26-year-old single woman. She operates a retail shop business and sells her goods in this shop. She's worked in this business for one year. Her primary customers are passersby and neighbours. 

Alice describes her greatest business challenges to be the high cost of transportation and seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. Alice will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. Alice aspires to open a new kiosk in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer lives in Bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 28 year old, married, and has two children. Both of them are still in school. 
 
Amer heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 54 years old. He is married to Anastacia and together they have six children. He operates a quarry and has been in the business for the past ten years.

This is his fourth loan with KADET LTD. He repaid his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan amount to purchase equipment used in the quarry, pay laborers, and pay for transportation of the stones.

He hopes to own a lorry to help in transporting the stones.

loans.use: to purchase equipment, pay laborers, and pay for transportation  of stones

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 27 years old and married with three children.  She tailors clothes to earn a living.  Eunice has been in the business for seven years and employs two people.  To earn extra income she sells second hand clothes.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future.  She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.use: To buy a tailoring machine

loans.name: Tülay

texts.en:
Tülay is married and has two children of ages 22 and 27.  One of her children goes to university.  Tülay cooks at home on a daily basis for the 10 single people living in the same apartment building with her. She also embroiders with a sewing machine and sells Oriflame cosmetic products. While doing all those she is trying to keep up with new developments in her areas of business as well as expanding her clientele. 

Tülay says that from time to time, she too comes across hardships being self-employed. This is her third loan from Maya and first with Kiva.  With this loan she intends to buy thread and fabric for her embroidery work, bulk ingredients for her cooking business, and cosmetics that are on bulk promotional campaigns. She remarks, “I want to invest in my future by expanding my businesses and at the same time pay into a retirement pension.” She is a resourceful and talented entrepreneur who keeps on renewing her business according to the needs of the time.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff,

Tülay Şeker evli ve 2 çocuğu var.  En küçüğü 22,en büyüğü 27 yaşında.  Çocuklardan biri üniversitede okuyor.  Tülay Hanım,evde yemek yapıyor.Apartmanında aynı evde oturan , bekar 10 kişiye günlük yemek hazırlıyor.  Aynı zamande makinede nakış yapıyor.  Oriflame kozmetik ürünleri pazarlıyor.  Bütün bunları yaparken,işinde yeniliklere ayak uydurmak için ve değişik pazarlar bulmak için çaba harcıyor.  Zaman zaman her işte olduğu gibi kendi işinde de zorluklarla karşılaştığını söylüyor.  Maya'dan aldığı bu 3.kredi.  Aldığı bu kredi ile nakış için kumaş ve iplik,yemek için toplu malzeme,kozmetik için de kampanya ürünlerini almak için kullanacak.  Gelecekte işlerimi ilerletmek ve geleceğime yatırım yapmak istiyorum.  Kendisine aynı zamanda emeklilik sigortası yaptıracak.  Tülay Hanım,girişimci,araştıran ve kendini yenileyen yetenekli bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric for her embroidery work, bulk ingredients for cooking business, and cosmetics that are on bulk promotional campaigns

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jennifer is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jennifer has a abaca (natural fiber) weaving business in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

Jennifer has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Jennifer would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca (natural fiber) weaving.

loans.name: Soumaïla

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Soumaïla a 35 ans, marié et père de quatre  enfants, il réside avec sa famille à Sanoubougou II Extension un des quartiers populaires de la ville  de Sikasso.
Monsieur Soumaïla après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié  il y a douze ans à cette activité de commerce d’achat vente d’articles divers de boutique. Il dispose d’une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il mène cette activité de vente de ses articles divers : Cigarette, bonbon, allumette, Chewing Gum, lait en poudre, thé, sucre, savon, etc. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année. Ainsi il est à son deuxième crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter, 10 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 4 sacs du sucre, 10 carton du thé, 5 paquets de bonbon, 5 paquet de Chewing Gum, 10 paquets d’allumette et 5 cartons de savon. Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
 Ses marchandises sont achetées auprès de commerçants grossistes de la ville avant de les revendre en détail dans sa boutique à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 110 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Soumaïla is 35 years old, married, and the father of four children.  He lives with his family in the Sanoubougou II Extension, a neighborhood in Sikasso.

After trying several businesses without success, twelve years ago Mr. Soumaïla started his business of buying and selling various shop items.  He has a shop in front of his family home where he sells a variety of items:  cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap, etc.  He is very much in demand due to the quality of his products.  To satisfy his growing customer base, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about a year ago.  This is his second loan, which will allow him to buy 10 cartons of different cigarettes, 4 bags of sugar, 10 cartons of tea, 5 packages of candy, 5 packages of chewing gum, 10 packages of matches, and 5 cartons of soap.  His previous loan was repaid correctly.

Mr. Soumaïla's products are purchased from wholesale supplies in the city before being resold in his shop to a diverse and varied customer base.  With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 110,000 FCFA, which will be used to contribute to family expenses, pay the interest on his loan, and invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various shop items.

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
Fany tiene de 39 años de edad y reside junto a su esposo y a sus 2 hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola de clima semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, la maracuyá y el limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. 

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega que se encuentra instalada en su domicilio. Ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario, los cuales prefieren su negocio debido a que siempre encuentran productos de calidad y son atendidos amablemente. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia. Adicionalmente también en la parte posterior de su domicilio cría, animales menores en su gran mayoría son aves de corral, las que ofrece a sus vecinos cada vez que hay festividades.

Fany desea ampliar su bodega adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Fany is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural region with a semitropical climate that produces primarily fruit such as mango, passion fruit, and lime.  It is in the Piura region and is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She works selling basic household necessities and groceries in a store set up in her house.  She offers her customers various products of daily consumption.  They prefer her business because they always find quality products and they are served in a friendly way.  She uses the income she receives from this work to help her husband get their family ahead.  Additionally, behind her house, she also raises small animals, the majority of which are fowl, which she sells to her neighbors every time there are festivities.

Fany wants to expand her store, acquiring more products so she can satisfy her current demand.  This is why she has thought it advisable to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1200 PEN, which will help her realize her goal.

loans.use: tp purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, etc. to stock her store

loans.name: Enemecia

texts.es: La señora Enemecia esta soltera, se dedica a su negocio de PULPERIA donde vende variedad de productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, pan, huevos, leche, jugos entre otros,  sus clientes son las personas que transitan por su negocio, cuenta con una antigüedad de hace más de 6 años, su sueño es que su negocio pueda crecer y así obtener mayores ingresos.  Esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 12,000.00  para invertirlos en la compra de productos  para su negocio.
texts.en: Señora Enemecia is single and runs a general store where she sells products such as rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, eggs, milk, juice, and other products. Her customers are passersby. She has been established for over six years, and her dream is for her business to be able to grow so that she can make a higher income. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 lempiras to invest in the purchase of products for her business.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, pasta, bread, milk, eggs, and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Revelita

texts.en:
Revelita is thankful because her previous loan has been useful in making her business grow. She is happily married and has been blessed with eight children. Six of her children are married and have their own families while the other two are still single and studying.

Revelita offers construction materials such as cement, hollow blocks,galvanized iron and steel. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than five years. She is glad because her husband is supportive in improving their business.

Revelita would like to buy more construction materials such as cement, hollow blocks, galvanized iron and steel to be able to improve her business. In this regard, she is requesting  additional capital amounting to P35,000 to purchase more construction materials. She hopes to obtain this loan amount so that she can support her youngest child's education and provide their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, hollow blocks, galvanized iron and  steel for her business

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 27 years old, married, and blessed with three children aged nine, six, and the last-born being six months old. She makes bricks, a business she started a year ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 18,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to help her make more bricks for sale. The profit she makes will help her pay school fees and expand her business. Her dream is to lead a good life and educate her children, and this is her first loan.

loans.use: To make more bricks for sale.

loans.name: Nkaani

texts.en:
Nkaani, aged 26, is a single mother of two children ages seven and 10 years. She sells cereals and has been doing this for six years. Monthly income from the business is KES 6,850.

This is her first loan from  KADET LTD. She will use the funds to buy rice, beans, maize and sorghum for sale. Nkaani hopes to start farming in future.

loans.use: To  buy rice, beans, maize and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen lives in Bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 29 years old, married, and has no children. 

Ayen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 54 years old. He is married to Ann and together they have four school-going children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past four years.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase seedlings and spraying chemicals for his farm.

His hope is to become the best farmer in his area.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and spraying chemicals for his farm.

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es: Ana Deysi de 46 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por 6 miembros. Ella se dedica  a la producción y venta de pan  dulce. Tiene aproximadamente 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia en el área y reconocimiento por muchas personas en la zona donde habita ya que es una mujer muy emprendedora, trabajadora y sobre todo carismática. Este negocio significa mucho para Ana, dado que es su principal fuente de ingresos y su deseo es mantenerlo por  más tiempo de tal forma que pueda seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su familia. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de la materia prima necesaria (harina, azúcar, colorantes, aceite, leche, leña, etc.) que le permita cubrir una mayor demanda, de tal forma que pueda mejorar sus ventas y por consecuencia sus ingresos. Confía en Dios que con su trabajo y dedicación logrará  el objetivo final  de  dar a su familia una mejor oportunidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Deysi is 46 years old and lives in her own home with six other family members. She produces and sells sweet breads. Because she has been doing this for about 5 years, she has much experience in this trade. She is known to many people in the area where she lives, as she is very enterprising, hardworking, and above all, charismatic. This business means a lot to Ana, given that it is her main source of income. Her desire is to keep it going longer, so that she can continue to support her family every day. 

This is the reason she is requesting this loan from INTEGRAL: to invest in her business by buying the necessary commodities (flour, sugar, food colorings, oil, milk, firewood, etc) to allow her to meet more demand. This way she can increase sales and, thereby, her income. She trusts God that with her work and dedication she will achieve her final objective to give her family a better opportunity in life.

loans.use: to buy: flour, sugar, food coloring, oil, milk, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Victor Justo

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre emprendedor el cual vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad en la que se desarrolla la agricultura, siendo los cultivos principales el esparrago, la uva, pallares entre otros; vive con su esposa la cual se dedica a las labores del hogar y la cual lo apoya en todo lo que hace.

Victor trabaja como chofer de taxi, el le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 9 horas al día, trabajaría un poco mas pero el auto que el conduce es alquilado y tiene que devolverlo en cierto horario, asimismo tiene una pequeña bodega donde vende productos como abarrotes; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicado y sobre todo amable con los clientes.

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá realizar mejoras en su bodega como cambiar el techo de esteras de su bodega a un techo de calaminas, así podrá proteger mejor su negocio y tener más seguridad, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando para cumplir su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Victor is an entrepreneur living in Ica, Peru. This is one of the agricultural areas of Peru, where they cultivate asparagus, grapes and Lima beans, among others. He lives with his wife who is a housewife and supports him in all that he does.

Victor works as a taxi driver for about 9 hours a day; he’d work longer hours but he rents the taxi and has to have it back on a schedule. He also owns a shop where he sells groceries. He thinks his business is going well because he’s very dedicated and friendly with his customers.

Victor is very grateful for the Kiva lenders, thanks to their help he’ll be able to renovate his shop, like change the sedge roof for a corrugated iron roof in order to protect his business and keep it safe, which will allow him to continue to work toward his big dream: “finish building my house”.

loans.use: add a corrugated iron roof to his house.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de 46 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa la cual es ama de casa y su hija de 16 años la cual se encuentra estudiando. Él se dedica al comercio de huevos al por mayor. Tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya es un experto en el área. La venta la realiza a domicilio a las diferentes tiendas, restaurantes y mini superes de la zona donde habita.  Con el tiempo ha sabido ganarse la confianza de muchas personas que cada día lo prefieren  por ser un hombre carismático, responsable y dedicado en su trabajo. Para él lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que cada día se levanta muy temprano para realizar su trabajo y poder suplir los pedidos que diariamente le realizan sus clientes. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la  compra de huevos al  por mayor con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes de tal forma que cada día sean más las personas que lo prefieren. Confía en Dios todo poderoso que obtendrá resultados favorables y logrará su sueño de dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Wilfredo, age 46, lives in his own home with his wife, a housewife, and their 16-year-old daughter who is in school. He has sold eggs for several years, so he is an expert in the area. He makes his sales by going to the various stores, restaurants and mini supermarkets in the area. With time, he has been able to gain the confidence of many people who prefer him because he is charismatic, responsible, and dedicated to his work. For Wilfredo, his family is the most important, and it is for them that he gets up very early every day to work. He must fill the orders that his clients make every day. He has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in his business by buying eggs wholesale. His goal is to provide a better customer service so that they will continue to prefer his service more and more. He trusts in God almighty that he will obtain good results and achieve his dream of providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy eggs wholesale.

loans.name: Leornard

texts.en:
Leornard is a 29-year-old single man. Leornard operates a farming business, farming maize and potatoes for sale and he sells his produce from home. He's worked in this business for two years. His primary customers are local neighbours. He describes his greatest business challenge to be the high cost of purchasing fertilizers and his highest monthly expense is food and rent bills. 

Leornard rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. Leornard will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Leornard aspires to expand and produce more profits in the future. He joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, aged 48, is married to Fred and they are blessed with five children aged between eight and 25 years. She runs a retail shop that has been in existence for nine years. Monthly income from the business is KES.10,100.

This is her second loan term with KADET LTD and she has a good credit history. She will use the funds to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil and rice for sale. Rebecca hopes to open a wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil and rice for sale

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
This is Crisanta, 59, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a widow. She manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Crisanta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 42,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Crisanta dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman. She has two children and both are enrolled in school. Mariam operates a food stall business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for six years. Her primary customers are local neighbours. 

Mariam's other source of income includes a side job as a tailor and her highest monthly expense is food  for the family. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Mariam will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase food to stock and cutlery for the business. Mariam aspires to establish a restaurant business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital

loans.use: to purchase food to stock and cutlery for the business.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 46 years old. He is married to Felister and together they have three children. He operates a food market and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by our client. He will use the loan amount to purchase stock of sugar, cereals and so on.

He hopes to own a retail shop.

loans.use: to  add more stock of sugar, cereals and such.

loans.name: Petrona Jacinta

texts.es: Petrona,62 años de edad es una comerciante quien tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, al mismo tiempo es ama de casa Ella quedo viuda pero la necesidad de terminar de criar a sus hijos la impulso a poner su propio negocio que le ayudara a pagar los gastos de su casa y la educación de sus hijos, Actualmente lleva 10 años con este negocio el cual le ha permitido sobrevivir. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, productos de limpieza, avenas, sopas, pan,huevo,leche,productos de aseo personal. Pues son productos de mucho demanda entre sus clientes y de los cuales necesitar surtir su negocio para vender mas seguir mejorando y ampliando su negocio.
texts.en: Petrona is 62. She is a retailer and she runs a general store in her house, and she is a housewife as well. She has been left a widow, and she has had to open her own shop on order to keep on providing for her children and to pay for the expenses of her house and the education of her children. She has been currently engaged in this activity for 10 years, and this has helped her to survive. She is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, cleaning products, oats, soups, bread, eggs, milk and toiletries: these are the products her customers mostly request, and she needs to supply her shop with them in order to improve her sales and to keep in improving and expanding her activity.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, cleaning products, oats, soups, bread, eggs, milk and toiletries

loans.name: Ester Mercedes

texts.es: Ester Mercedes de 38  años de edad y vive en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar, el cual está conformado por su esposo y sus hijos  los tres se encuentran estudiando y son la inspiración de la señora  Ester. Ella se dedica al comercio de tienda. El negocio se encuentra ubicado en su hogar de residencia el cual  ha sabido adecuar de acuerdo a las instalaciones de su casa de tal forma que pueda atraer la atención de los clientes. La señora Ester es muy reconocida en la zona donde habita ya que se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y sobre todo honesta. Muchas personas prefieren sus productos ya que ofrece variedad, calidad y buenos precios. Este negocio es muy importante para la señora Ester ya que es una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos,  esto la impulsa a estar muy atenta y muy pendiente del rumbo de su negocio, es decir,  trata la manera de estar siempre un paso adelante de la competencia de tal forma que su negocio pueda liderar en la zona donde habita. Todo esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su tienda en la  compra de variedad de productos de tienda como: arroz, frijoles, leche, café, aceite, golosinas, azúcar, papel, etc. de tal forma de que los clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan y estén satisfechos con su servicio. De esta manera espera vender más productos y   mejorar sus ingresos que le permitan dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia; principalmente a sus hijos que cada día demandan más.
texts.en: Ester Mercedes, 38, lives in her own house with her family. Her family consists of her husband and her 3 children who are in school – they are Ester’s inspiration. She is a shopkeeper. Her business is located in her house and she was able to install it in such a way that it attracts the attention of customers. Ester is well-known in her area and characterizes herself as a hard worker, responsible, and above all, honest. Many people prefer her products as she offers a big variety of quality products at good prices. This business is very important for Ester as it’s one of her principal incomes. This pushes her to be attentive to the ebb and flow of her business; that is to say, she always tries to be one step ahead of the competition so her business can come out on top in the area where she lives. This has also moved her to make the decision to request a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in a variety of products for her shop. She will buy rice, beans, milk, coffee, oil, candy, sugar, paper, etc., so her customers will always find what they’re looking for and find satisfaction in her customer service. That way, she hopes to sell more products and improve her income in order to give her family a better quality of life, especially for her children who demand more every day.

loans.use: buy rice, beans, milk, coffee, oil, candy, sugar, paper, etc.

loans.name: Hilda Margarita

texts.es: Hilda Margarita  31 años de edad, habita en casa de sus padres junto con sus tres hijos dos de los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Para la señora Hilda lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que trabaja duramente para poder dar el pan de cada día y cubrir algunas necesidades. Ella  se dedica a la producción y venta de ricas pupusas. Tiene algunos años de experiencia en esta actividad, además, ha logrado establecer algunos clientes que son muy fieles al servicio que ella ofrece. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales, en mejores condiciones que las que ella ha tenido. Esta es la razón por la que lucha con todas sus fuerzas para mantener vivo el negocio que por muchos años les ha proporcionado lo necesario para sobrevivir. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio es decir poder tener la capacidad de cubrir una mayor demanda que le genere mayores ingresos. Esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la materia prima necesaria  (maíz, arroz, aceite, queso, chicharrones, frijoles, etc.), que le permita lograr su objetivo de cubrir una mayor demanda que le genere una mejora en los ingresos percibidos de tal forma que su calidad de vida y la de su familia puedan mejorar con el tiempo.
texts.en:
Hilda Margarita, 31 years old, lives in her parents' home with her three children, two of whom are studying. For Hilda, the most important thing is her family; therefore, she works very hard to support them and cover some necessities. She makes and sells delicious, filled tortillas. She has some years of experience at this trade and also has been able to establish some very loyal customers for the service she offers. Her dream is to see her children become professionals, in better circumstances than she has had.

This is the reason she works with all her strength to keep her business going. For many years it has provided them with what they needed to survive. Her dream is to expand her business, that is, to have the ability to meet more demand, which will generate more income. This had led her to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the necessary commodities (corn, rice, oil, cheese, pork rinds, beans, etc.) to reach her goal of meeting more demand. This will increase her income so that, over time, her quality of life and that of her family can improve.

loans.use: to buy: corn, rice, oil, cheese, pork rinds, beans, etc.

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia is married with three children.  She is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Gorgonia is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living.  She has been doing this for five years.  She has requested a loan of 12000 PHP to purchase three sacks of feed and maintenance medicine.
Gorgonia has been a member of PMPC for 12 years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business .

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of feed and maintenance medicines for her pig raising business.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris, aged 42, is a single mother of three children who are 15,10, and five years old.  She runs a restaurant and has been in operation for two years.  She earns a monthly income of KES 14,600.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD.  She will use the funds to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, rice and sugar. Peris hopes to open a big modern restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, cooking oil, rice and sugar for the business.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija is a single woman.  She has six children between the ages of 5 months and 21 years.  Five of her children are enrolled in school.  Hadija operates a vegetable stall business and sells her goods as retail.  She has worked in this business for five years.  Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby.  She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Hadija will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell.  Hadija aspires to open a new kiosk at the market in the future.  She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Nyiel

texts.en:
Nyiel lives in Bor, South Sudan.  She sells food stall items, and has been in this business for five years.  She is 38 year old, married, and has five children.  Three of them are still in school. 
Nyiel heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase maize and sugar.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase maize and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 29 years old and married with one child.  He runs a beauty salon to earn a living.  He has been in the business for three years and employs one person.  He runs a grocery store to earn extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to save his income and he hopes to expand his business in the future.  Patrick has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a hair blow dry machine and a hairdryer.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow dry machine and a hairdryer.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 30 years old and married with two children.  She sells bananas, beans, rice, and tea leaves to earn a living.  She has been in the business for one year and employs one person.  To earn extra income she does farming.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and she hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has applied for 25,000 Kenya Shillings to buy bananas, beans, rice, and tea leaves to sell.

loans.use: To buy bananas, beans, rice and tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: Sarah Gabriela

texts.es: La Señorita Sarah, de ocupación Promotora de Ventas de Productos de Belleza, aún sigue estudiando en la Universidad Estatal de la ciudad de Tarija , no tiene hijos, es estado Civil soltera, aún vive en la casa de su madre, como hija mayor ayuda económicamente a su familia, de ella dependen económicamente tres de sus hermanos, por ello presento una solicitud de crédito ya que necesita incrementar su Capital de Operaciones para poder adquirir más productos de Belleza de línea argentina y de esa manera colaborar a sus hermanos con la ganancia que obtenga, pues necesita para que puedan seguir estudiando hasta tener una profesión , de esa manera podrán aportar un granito de arena en la canasta familiar lo cual para la cliente será un logro importante, por ello solicita y será de mucho beneficio para la cliente el que se le otorgue el crédito Kiva para poder seguir trabajando y poder colaborar aún más a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Sarah, a beauty products sales representative, is still studying at Tarija State University. She is single and has no children. She still lives in her mother's house, and as the eldest daughter, helps her family financially. 

Three of her siblings depend on her financially, so she applied for a loan, as she needs to increase her working capital. This will enable her to buy more beauty products from the Argentina line, and that way help her siblings with the profits she will earn. 

She needs to do this so that they can continue going to school until they have a profession. That way they will be able to contribute their part to the family's household expenses. This will be an important accomplishment for the client, and that is why she is applying. 

It will be greatly to the client's benefit for her to be granted a Kiva loan, so that she can continue working, and be able to help her family financially even more.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products from the Argentina line.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos quines aun son dependientes, viven junto a su esposa en casa propia ubicada en una zona urbana del Distrito de Olmos, a unas 2 horas de la provincia de Lambayeque, en su distrito se ha hecho muy conocida y querida por todos sus vecinos.

La actividad a la que se dedica es al servicio de tapizado de vehículos menores (mototaxis), junto a su esposo iniciaron hace 4 años este negocio el cual hasta la fecha le ha sido muy rentable, pues es el único en su lugar y ya con sus ganancias han logrado comprar algunas de sus herramientas de trabajo como por ejemplo una maquina de coser, el local donde ellos trabajan esta instalado en una parte de su propio domicilio.
Al ser el único lugar de tapizado en la zona donde vive su clientela ha aumentado considerablemente por lo que le hacen falta algunos materiales de trabajo, pues ya no se abastece y también quiere acondicionar mejor su local para poder contratar personal que pueda apoyar en la atención de sus clientes.
Esta solicitando un crédito a edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales los utilizara para realizar sus compras de carpas, hilos y para el mantenimiento de su maquina.
El esta seguro de que progresará en su negocio por lo que esta bien administrado por ambos esposos.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, married and has two sons who are still dependent. They all live in their own house in an urban area of the district of Olmos, some two hours from Lambayeque Province. Maria has become well known and loved by all her neighbors. 

She provides upholstery services for small vehicles (motorcycle taxis) and started this business with her husband four years ago. Until now this has  been a very profitable business since it is the only one in the area and since with the earnings they have been able to buy some of their work tools such as, for example, a sewing machine. The business space where they work is installed in one part of their home. Being the only upholstery place in the area where they live, their clientele has increased considerably, which is why they need some work materials since they do not have enough and also they want to better equip the premises so they are able to hire personnel who can help care for their customers.

Maria is applying for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of S/. 2,000 which she will use to purchase canvas, thread and for maintenance on her machine.

She is sure she will progress in her business because it is well managed by both husband and wife.

loans.use: to buy work materials (canvas, thread and maintenance on her sewing machine).

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer lives in Bor.  She sells food stall items, and has been in business for two years. She is 38 year old, married, and has six children.  Four of her children are still in school. 
Amer heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase beans and maize.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and maize for sale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 51 years old and married to Rangenyi who is a businessman.  She is a fishmonger and has been in the business for one year.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her neighbors who is a KADET client. 

She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stocks of fish for sale and be able to meet her clients demands and serve them better. 

In the future, Alice hopes to expand her business and distribute fish to other towns and industries outside Nakuru and thereby increase her income and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Jose Felipe

texts.es:
Jose, es comerciante  vende leña aunque también realiza trabajos de soldadura, tiene tres hijos los cuales están estudiando la secundaria. Su experiencia en esta actividad es desde los 12 años de edad que fue cuando el empezó a trabajar y ganarse la vida por si mismo el vendía leña para ayudar a su familia a comprar alimentos luego que terminaba de vender leña se dedico a aprender a soldar para esta manera ganarse su dinero de manera honrada. El sale a vender leña en las comunidades cercanas en las afuera de León cuando no se dedica a vender el trabaja soldando. 
El va a utilizar el crédito para comprar leña y comprar materia prima para realizar sus trabajos de soldadura. Pues el desea brindar calidad en los trabajos que realiza para ello necesita herramientas en buen estado y suficiente material de trabajo para cubrir sus pedidos.
texts.en: Jose is a merchant who sells firewood and also does welding work.  He has 3 children who are studying in middle school. He has been doing this kind of work since he was 12 years old, which was when he started to work and provide for himself.  He sold firewood to help his family buy food.  Later, he stopped selling firewood and learned to weld, so that he could make money in an honest way.  He goes out to sell firewood in the nearby communities on the outskirts of Leon when he is not doing welding work.  He will use this loan to buy firewood and to buy supplies for his welding work.  He wants to do quality work, and so he needs tools that are in good condition and enough raw materials and supplies so that he can cover his orders.

loans.use: to buy firewood and supplies for his welding business

loans.name: Agot

texts.en:
Agot lives in Bor.  She sells clothes and has been in this business for one year.  She is 28 year old, married, and has no children. 
Agot heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC and she has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase clothes.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a conservative woman who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo while he is playing with two of his children in front of their house.

Eman is a 42 year old woman.  She is the mother of two sons and four daughters.  Her husband is a guard at a local factory and he earns a low salary.  It is not enough to cover the family's costs and to pay for the completion of the home's construction which began ten years ago.

Eman is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the expenses of the construction as well as to improve its condition with things such as: painting, installing tiles, and installing a new ceiling for the house.  Taking this loan will create for Eman and her family a better and more comfortable home condition.

loans.use: To complete construction of her house.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
This is Vicky.  She is 43 years old and a resident of Manila, in the Philippines.  Her husband Antonio is a sales manager, and a father to her two children. She together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating a business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Vicky maintains a direct selling business.  She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands.  A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer, and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit.  Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 4000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12, 000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy more orders for her customers.  She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Vicky hopes to be more successful with her business and dreams to be able to give her children a good future through all her hard work.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.  At these meetings she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
This is Nieva.  She is 47 and a resident of Manila, in the Philippines.  Her husband Renedante, is a sea man, and a mother to her child.  She together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Nieva operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg.   She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and then selling by the piece.  Her store is located adjacent to her house.   She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 42,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She expects a boost in income as she expands her business. 

Nieva dreams to grow her business in the coming years.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.  She can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies at these meetings.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 46-year-old married woman. She is from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Alia has a home-based grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase goods needed 
.
Alia is looking to establish a store away from her home so that she can increase her income and enlarge her customer base, thus providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 48-year-old married man and the father of three children for whom he works hard to provide the best living.

Ali is a hardworking man who, 16 years ago, opened his own workshop with 25 years of experience. Most of his customers are loyal because of his experience in his industry. Ali works hard on improving his business. 

He applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy an updated manufacturing machine necessary for his business. This machine will help him create good quality products in a short period of time.

This is Ali's first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he is excited for the upcoming deals that he hopes will help develop his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: to buy an updated manufacturing machine necessary for his business.

loans.name: Réussite Plus Group

texts.en:
Anne is the chairwoman of the community bank Réussite Plus, which is composed of 32 microentrepreneurs. These members are united for the same goal of growing their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Anne is a 27-year-old single woman who sells clothing. She buys clothes in bulk and resells them to make a profit. She sells her products daily in her area.

Anne started her business in 2010. She is a trustworthy client of MFI HOPE RDC, having twice obtained and correctly repaid loans. This loan will allow her to buy clothing in larger quantities to increase her sales in order to make a better profit. Anne makes a profit of about $350 per month. Her ambition is to some day open a general store.

loans.use: to buy clothing in larger quantities to resell at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
This is Luisa.  She is 34 years old and a resident of Manila, in the Philippines.  She is married to Rufo, a barge worker, and father to her children.  She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating a business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Luisa is a mineral water distributor.  What she basically does is buy mineral water in containers from wholesalers, and then sell them individually with a profit.  She also earns additional income by selling breakfast food items.  Her regular customers within her mineral water business are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 17, 000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of mineral water to expand her product.  She expects a boost in income as she expands her business.  

Luisa dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.  She can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies at the meetings.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business.

loans.name: Ne'ma

texts.en:
Ne'ma is a 53-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Ne'ma is selling clothes and perfumes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more quantities of products.

Ne'ma is looking to establish a shop for her business outside her home and she is dreaming of purchasing a home instead of her current rented one.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Fatimah is a conservative person. She is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet so the man in the photo is her husband.

Fatima is a 41-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Al Balqa'a, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Fatimah started her home-based business by purchasing goats. Then she enlarged it by making yougurt products and cheese. Now she is requesting a loan of 1200 JD to purchase materials needed for her business.

Fatimah is looking to expand her business through contracting with retailers and distributors to sell her products with an aspiration of providing her children with the best life.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for making yougurt and cheese

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata is 50 years old and married with two children. She sells sweaters, blouses and skirts to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and she hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sweaters, blouses and skirts to sell.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, blouses and skirts to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 20 years old and owns a computer store for sales and maintenance. He will use the loan to purchase an air conditioner and shelves, and build an attic. He hopes through this loan to expand his stock to purchase computers in bulk, offer lower prices to his customers, and attract more customers into his air-conditioned store.

loans.use: to purchase an air conditioner and shelves, and to build an attic for his store

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is a 32-year-old single young man. He is employed with a low salary, but not enough to cover his daily costs. Yasser is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new bedroom furniture. Taking this loan will offer Yasser comfortable home furniture and he will be able to live in better home conditions as he is a young man and wants to have some privacy at home.

Yasser is photographed in his house.

loans.use: To purchase new bedroom furniture

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 52-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Aida is doing handmade crafts. She started her business making dolls and then she expanded into making accessories and gifts boxes.

Aida is looking to establish a shop for her home-based business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and raw materials

loans.name: Moufdel

texts.en:
Moufdel is a 34-year-old single man, working in a construction business for 7 years. He is specialized in cement work, and is recommended by most of his customers.

Moufdel is a hard worker. He has good communication skills with his customers. His business is his only source of living - that's why he has to work on developing it all the time. 

His machines must be updated all the time to stay in good order and that's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua - in order to do necessary maintenance for his cement blending machine.

Moufdel hopes he can buy an updated cement machine in the future.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance for his cement blending machine

loans.name: Mayra Karina

texts.es: Mayra es una mujer de 30 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su negocio de servicios telefonicos. Su historia empezó con una cabina telefónica luego implemento una computadora para dar mas rapides a sus servicios, su trabajo lo hace sola, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, si tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es poder otro cyber. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su servicio telefonico asi poder comprar telefonos para mas clientes y papeleria para vernder.
texts.en: Mayra is 30 years old and has many aspirations for her internet cafe business in the coming years. She started out with a calling center and then added a computer for faster services. She works alone and doesn't encounter many problems. She isn't married and doesn't have children. Her biggest dream is to open another internet cafe. She is requesting the loan to purchase stationery to sell and to buy more telephones so she can have more customers.

loans.use: to purchase stationery and telephones.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Isidro tiene 52 años de edad y es casado sin carga familiar directa. Actualmente su vivienda está ubicada en una zona rural llamada las Dunas ubicado 5 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque. Su vivienda cuenta con los servicios básicos (agua y energía eléctrica). Su comunidad es pequeña de aproximadamente 500 familias. Isidro se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años. El negocio esta situado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir tiene experiencia y conoce a la perfección el rubro. El suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.
